issue_title: [FEAT] Prefetching hook that fetches server state data ( maybe based on action + resource)
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

I think currently refine doesnt have a prefetch hook for a resource. Like if a user is hovering on a link/button or wherever the entity maybe, the developer might want to trigger prefetching based on it, however currently we dont have such hook to do so.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

The goal of prefetching is to make data fetch before the user navigates to a page or attempts to load some known content.  This will improve the user experience on page navigations as it will greatly cut down on the loading time due to the data being quickly available and we wont have to see the skeleton/loaders on our screen.

### Describe the thing to improve

I think a simple usePrefetch hook will be great where we can pass it action and resource.

issue_title: [FEAT] Option for a toast message with CanAccess/CatchAllNavigate component
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Currently with **CanAccess** component, I am unable to show a toast message. This is how I am calling it, where the fallback is a navigation component.
```tsx
<CanAccess fallback={<CatchAllNavigate to="/" />} >
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

One way to hack it is by wrapping my fallback inside a component which will just fire a toast (either that or I can just customise my fallback to handle the toast).

### Additional context

At present, **CanAccess** works but there is no visual feedback unless I chose to make the fallback be a component that lays out the reason. Lets say the user tries to access a page that he doesn't have access to directly through the URL. Now the **CanAccess** component will run and redirect him back to whatever the fallback component is, but there would be no visual feedback if **used along side a navigation component** (like in my case). At least the way that I am using it which is with navigation back to my home page, upon redirection there is no visual feedback as to why the user wasnt able to access that page. Adding an option to show toast upon redirection will be helpful. 

### Describe the thing to improve

Maybe we can have an optional prop to show a toast. 

For example in the case of **CanAccess** we can have optional props like **showToast** and **toastMessage**. If the showToast is **true** and no **toastMessage** is passed the CanAccess component can just get the reason that we defined in the accessProvider. As noticed that **reason** is an optional **CanReturnType** so maybe we can just have **default message** that runs if the **showToast is true** **however**, both the reason in accessProvider and, toastMessage as a prop is not provided, then in this case the default message will be shown in the toast.

We can also choose to employ the same logic inside the **CatchAllNavigate** component (excluding the reason as this is a routing mechanism).

issue_title: [FEAT]In previous versions, if the Table of Contents was empty on an article page, it would be centered.
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

In previous versions, if the Table of Contents was empty on an article page, it would be centered.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I think that it would be visually more pleasing and comfortable if article pages were centered when the table of contents is disabled or not present.

### Additional context

I'm glad you like the layout of the article page, and I can definitely help you with centering it automatically. There are several ways to achieve this, depending on the structure of your webpage and the CSS styles that you're using.

One easy way is to set the `margin` property of the container element to `auto`. This will center the element horizontally within its parent container. Here's an example CSS rule that you could add to your stylesheet:

```css
.article-container {
  margin: auto;
}
```

In this example, `.article-container` is the class name of the container element that wraps around your article content. You can replace this with the actual class or ID name of your container element.

If you need further assistance with implementing this change, please let me know!

### Describe the thing to improve

i hope can do it's

issue_title: [BUG] LiveProvider generates wrong graphql subscription query
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

When I use the LiveProvider for a graphql subscription from @refinedev/graphql, a query is created starting with "query" instead of "subscription".

Find documentation about subscription here: https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/core/providers/live-provider/#creating-a-live-provider-with-graphql-subscriptions

The generateUseListSubscription function uses `gql.query` instead of `gql.subscription`.
https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blob/6fdf9c002c55359a7c6fcd7e03b3ca0698a44996/packages/graphql/src/utils/generateUseListSubscription.ts#L42

issue_title: [BUG] Inferencer relationInfer issue with accessor key
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

I override the field tags with field **_fieldTransformer_**

```tsx
    {
        key: "tags",
        type: "relation",
        relation: true,
        multiple: true,
        resource: { name: "tags", route: "/tags" },
        relationInfer: {
            accessor: "name",
        },
        accessor: "id",
    },
```

And If the record's tag array does not have any item, the next records on the list does not mapped with the accessor key.

```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "title": "1111123dasdasd",
  "content": "adasdasdasd",
  "published": true,
  "authorId": null,
  "categoryId": 2,
  "tags": [
    
  ],
}

```

issue_title: [DOC] Antd > Components > Buttons > Create is out-of-date
issue_body:
### Documentation issue

While I was searching through abilities to change the `create`-Button on CRUD pages, I found out that the following page is out-of-date: https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/antd/components/buttons/create-button/

The documentation references a `headerButtons` on the `Table` component of `antd`, which does not exist (anymore).

### Describe the thing to improve

To pass props to the `create`-Button one has to adjust the `createButtonProps` on top of the `List` component that is being imported from `refinedev/antd`. You can probably use the `headerButtons` prop to pass in other button-components but that's something I will probably not need (but might be useful in the docs).

### Describe the solution (optional)

_No response_

issue_title: [BUG] queryOptions on useModalForm doesn't seem to work properly
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

## System Info

- [ ] All required packages are up to date.
- [ ] Core and AntD libraries are being used.

### Last week, I migrated from version 3 to version 4.

I encountered a bug related to how ids are handled in your library. Due to the way ids are handled, I had to refactor my usage of the `useModalForm` hook.

Here's the original code:
```tsx
/*
* @description In the following example, only:
* https://localhost:5507/api/directory/Internal/v1/Organizations/180b5f6b-0411-46f1-a217-bf4e93bdb99e
* will be fetched, and https://localhost:5507/api/directory/Internal/v1/Organizations won't ever be called 
*/
const {
    queryResult: orgQueryResult,
    modalProps: updateOrgModalProps,
    formProps: updateOrgFormProps,
    show: showUpdateOrgModal,
    close: closeUpdateOrgModal
} = useModalForm<Organization, HttpError, IOrganizationFormValues>({
    action: 'edit',
    // Notice that 'id' is missing, but it's a part of the resource (query fetched exactly once)
    resource: `directory/Internal/v1/Organizations/${record?.organizationId as string}`,
    redirect: false,
    queryOptions: {
        enabled: Boolean(record?.organizationId)
    },
    onMutationSuccess: () => {
        closeUpdateOrgModal()
    }
})
```

Here's what I'm being forced to refactor with the new version:

```tsx
/*
* @description In the following example, both:
* https://localhost:5507/api/directory/Internal/v1/Organizations/180b5f6b-0411-46f1-a217-bf4e93bdb99e
* will be fetched, and https://localhost:5507/api/directory/Internal/v1/Organizations will also be called.
* The latter could potentially be a query with thousands of records (resulting in a significant performance hit).
*/
const orgId = record?.organizationId || undefined;
const {
    queryResult: orgQueryResult,
    modalProps: updateOrgModalProps,
    formProps: updateOrgFormProps,
    show: showUpdateOrgModal,
    close: closeUpdateOrgModal
} = useModalForm<Organization, HttpError, IOrganizationFormValues>({
    action: 'edit',
    id: orgId, // Notice that now I pass the 'id' as a prop
    resource: `directory/Internal/v1/Organizations`,
    redirect: false,
    syncWithLocation: false,
    queryOptions: {
        enabled: Boolean(orgId)
    },
    onMutationSuccess: () => {
        closeUpdateOrgModal()
    }
})
console.log('orgId:', orgId);
console.log('orgId enabled:', Boolean(orgId));
console.log('orgId orgQueryResult:', orgQueryResult?.data?.data);
```

### Why does this happen?

I am quite certain that this issue occurs because you set the id to an empty string. When the id is empty, the underlying hook used for fetching assumes that it is acceptable to fetch the resource and sends a query to the wrong path. However, once the id is received, the hook realizes it needs to re-render and re-fetch the correct data. In the end, the data turns out to be correct, and the form works as expected.

Unfortunately, there is no way to disable the initial query that is made for an endpoint with a similar name but is not the desired query. Here's an example of what should and should not be triggered:

Desired Query:
- `api/directory/Internal/v1/Organizations/{someId}`

Undesired Query (should not be triggered if id is undefined):
- `api/directory/Internal/v1/Organizations`

### Steps To Reproduce

- [ ] create a useModalForm that depends on an id from other query
- [ ] make sure there are routes for `/posts` and `/posts/{id}`(must be same)
- [ ] observe both /posts and /posts/{id} is called when id is undefined 

### Expected behavior

 - [ ] The query is not enabled when Id is missing

### Screenshot

`Just logs to make sure the enabled can be false:`
![Screenshot 2023-05-30 at 12 07 10 PM](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/assets/54914693/25fc4c16-478c-4c09-8923-306e3cfa3569)

`Screenshots that the query is "duplicated" - wrong query is made if id is undefined`

![Screenshot 2023-05-30 at 12 15 57 PM](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/assets/54914693/b1c919b6-00be-4053-9baf-43f6
![Screenshot 2023-05-30 at 12 16 16 PM](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/assets/54914693/fb21f318-6b63-41db-b70d-e1d301939559)
2c1db800)
![Screenshot 2023-05-30 at 12 16 27 PM](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/assets/54914693/59b94294-f457-48d6-b314-f7f609e84c96)


### Desktop

_No response_

### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

issue_title: [BUG] Next 13 app dir router breaks Create and List components navigation
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

In a Next 13 with app directory, we can't go back from a Create page using the Create component to a List page using the List component.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a refine context in a client component, imports the next app router from `@refinedev/nextjs-router/app`, then provide the client component in the root layout.

2. Create a list and create pages

```ts
'use client'

import { List } from '@refinedev/chakra-ui'

export default async function Page() {
    return (
        <List canCreate resource="test">
            test 1
        </List>
    )
}
```
```ts
'use client'

import { List } from '@refinedev/chakra-ui'

export default async function Page() {
    return (
        <Create resource="test">
            test 2
        </Create>
    )
}
```

3. Go to the list page and click on the Create button
4. On the Create page, click on the return button
5. The URL will change but not the page content. The page will be stuck.

### Expected behavior

Going  back from a Create page to a List page should not crash the app.

### Desktop

OS: Ubuntu 22.04

```
"next": "13.4.4"
"@refinedev/chakra-ui": "2.14.2"
"@refinedev/core": "4.16.2"
"@refinedev/nextjs-router": "5.3.0"
```

issue_title: [BUG] the 'queryOptions.enabled' option of useSelect does not work as intende
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

According to the [document](https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/core/hooks/useSelect/#defaultvaluequeryoptions), queryOptions will be used when defaultValueQueryOptions is not passed in, but everything does not execute as expected when there is a defaultValue

### Steps To Reproduce

```javascript
useSelect({
  resource: "todos",
  defaultValue: 1,
  queryOptions: {
    enabled: false,
  },
});
```

### Expected behavior

Due to the 'enabled' being set to false, as expected, no requests should be made until it becomes true.

issue_title: [BUG] Inferencer assumes `id` is number
issue_body: ### Describe the bug At least for the AntD Inferencers, the `id` is interpolated directly into the id property, seemingly assuming that it is a number: ```tsx export const ${COMPONENT_NAME}: React.FC = () => { const { queryResult } = useShow(${ isCustomPage ? `{ resource: "${resource.name}", id: ${id}, // <----- HERE ${getMetaProps( resource?.identifier ?? resource?.name, meta, "getOne", )} }` ``` If one is using UUIDs or any other string-based ids, the Inferencer fails as the string is not properly assigned: ### Steps To Reproduce 1. Setup a test page with an inferencer. 2. Pass a string as an `id` with either `show` or `edit` actions. 3. Navigate to page and see error. ### Expected behavior Component is able to fetch the data and render the component fully. ### Screenshot ### Desktop _No response_ ### Mobile _No response_ ### Additional Context _No response_

issue_title: [BUG] - setFilters with filters.mode="off" not updating the table
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

when using external search box to filter a table with filter.mode set to "off" the filter query is correctly displayed on the location bar but the table will not be updated until the page is refreshed. i forked the basic example of react-table with charka-ui and able to reproduce the issue. 

### Steps To Reproduce

open https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/solitary-architecture-fne4uq?file=%2Fsrc%2Fpages%2Fposts%2Flist.tsx%3A140%2C21 
on the text filed "search by title" type any of the title eg. rter 
the table is not filtered.  even though the query string on location bar is set correctly

but if filters.mode is set to server or cleared the table will be filtered as expected. 


### Expected behavior

the table should be updated when user types text on the search field without requesting the server if  filter.mode is set to "off".

issue_title: [BUG] In ArchLinux, While creating app with refine doesn't initialize the git repository.
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

> **Note**
Only happening for ArchLinux

I wanted to create a next.js project using refine with app directory.
But I noticed one thing that it doesn't initialize the git repository.
Then I created applicaion with different flags but none of them were initializing git repo.


### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a project with any example
2. You'll probably see the error

### Expected behavior

Should create the project with git repo initialized.

### Screenshot

![refine](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/assets/71123337/cdfb6aa8-7a09-481c-8f89-92ba4f5c15af)
Doesn't create the repo
But it does in Windows.
If there is something wrong with my side do let me know

### Desktop

- OS: ArchLinux
- Browser: Google Chrome
- Version: 113.0.5672.126 (Official Build) (64-bit) 

### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

issue_title: [BUG] Blog footer darkmode text
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

When in dark mode, the footer text is of dark color. That is, the text color is according to light mode even in dark mode. There should be a contrast between the background and the text, which is absent in this case, when in dark mode blog website, footer location

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Got to the Website (https://refine.dev/blog/)
2. Click on the dark mode button and activate it
3. Scroll down to see the footer
4. See an error; you will have difficulty in reading the text as it's not according to the dark mode

### Expected behavior

I expect the text color to be white in color when in dark mode. So the users can easily read it and there should be a contrast between the background and the text color

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Desktop

_No response_

### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

issue_body:

issue_title: [BUG] Supabase - Inferencer skips reference fields
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

In the `orders` table, I have a reference field `address_id` but this field is skipped in `Inferencer` generated code.

![Przechwytywanie](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/assets/17653648/bd0949eb-3a42-40a5-9848-d943b126759a)

![image](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/assets/17653648/c497d9bf-6f08-4a52-8589-535f7f4fa95f)

As you can see, there is no `Address` field in the UI.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Download this project: [cyan-views-cover.zip](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/files/11467871/cyan-views-cover.zip)
2. Run
```
npm install
npm run serve
```
3. Look at the `Inferencer` generated code.

### Expected behavior

`Inferencer` should generate the code for reference fields.

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Desktop

- Windows 11
- Brave 1.51.114 Chromium: 113.0.5672.92
- @refinedev/cli: 2.5.3
- @refinedev/core: 4.14.3
- @refinedev/inferencer: 3.3.4
- @refinedev/supabase: 5.5.2

_No response_

issue_title: [BUG] PreviousData does not get populated in Audit when update event is triggered
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

Using a sample provided on refine website -[https://codesandbox.io/s/github/refinedev/refine/tree/next/examples/audit-log-provider?from-embed](url) or by installing the same sample, **previousData** does not get populated.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open [https://codesandbox.io/s/github/refinedev/refine/tree/next/examples/audit-log-provider?from-embed](url) or install the sample  - npm create refine-app@latest -- --example audit-log-provider
2. Open Inspect
3. Click on edit button
4. Update something on the edit page
5. On Network tab look for logs endpoint and under preview tab validate that **previousData** is not defined.

### Expected behavior

When an update event is triggered, **previousData** should contain previous data information.

### Screenshot

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11629784/236332376-8dae6c37-0743-4d5b-a4bf-4f94fa56d90d.png)

issue_title: [BUG] Missing `dayjs` dependency on first `Build & Download` execution
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

When I build and download my project, I had a missing dependency.
I solved it only adding the missing dependency, but it's not a plug-n-play solution

```
❯ pnpm run dev

issue_title: [BUG] Supabase not receiving back data on insert/update
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

Supabase (PostgREST) requires explicitly asking for data back when creating or updating using `.select()`, which is not currently present.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Setup a project with supabase as data provider
2. Use the `useCreate` (or `useUpdate`) hook
3. The data, both the awaited value and the `onSuccess` callback, are undefined

### Expected behavior

The data is returned as inserted (or updated).

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Desktop

_No response_

### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

Adding `.select()` (https://supabase.com/docs/reference/javascript/insert) is required to set the `Prefer: return=representation` header that PostgREST requires to actually return data (https://postgrest.org/en/stable/api.html#insertions).

issue_title: [FEAT] Local filtering (and sorting?)
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

There are "lists" that are not too long. For example, 20-30 items.

In this size, it makes more sense to serve them all at once to the client and operate on them locally.

This is already possible with the paginations side:
```
    pagination: {
      mode: "client",
    },
```

but filtering still sends a request to the server every time.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

If we can have a global "client" mode, not just for pagination.
So that filtering and sorting will get done on the local data set.


EDIT:
The reason I want this implemented on refine, rather than simply filter the array myself is integration with everythings else.
Most importantly, the url changing to reflect the filter

issue_title: [BUG] Multiple MUI Autocomplete not clearing previous search value
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

When using `multiple` prop on an MUI Autocomplete with refines `useAutocomplete` when you search for the next value after selecting the one you have found, the options returned are what you seen in the previous search. It clears it self when you start typing.

The default MUI component doesn't have this behaviour, you can try it out via their [docs](https://mui.com/material-ui/react-autocomplete/#multiple-values)



### Steps To Reproduce

1. Using tutorial edit the generated Categrory Autocomplete component for creating a blog post
2. You will have to not pass the `field` prop as it errors, and I don't know why, another bug?
3. Add the `multiple` prop to the Autocomplete component
4. Go to /blog-post/create
5. Type "non" in the Category and select the first option 
6. Click the Categrory option again, the same options will appear
7. If you type they will change

### Expected behavior

When clicking the component I'd expect the default list of options again, not the previous searched options.

issue_title: [BUG] syncWithLocation sort not working properly
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

The built-in `syncWithLocation` feature does not work correctly with the sort feature as it does not load onto the tables. It gets saved to the URL, but when the URL is loaded, the sort does not affect the table.


### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a Refine Repo
2. Create a list/table with `useList` or `useDataGrid`
3. Enable `syncWithLocation` in the `<Refine ... options={{ syncWithLocation: true }}  />`
4. Go on a view with a table, and play around with the sort (and perhaps filters & pagination)
5. Notice how they do get saved properly onto the URL search params.
6. Now copy and paste the URL containing a sort parameter onto a new tab
7. Upon loading in new tab, notice how the sort parameter is deleted from the URL and the sort is not used in the table.

### Expected behavior

The expected behaviour is that the sort parameters defined in the URL search params, properly load onto the table/list.

### Screenshot

### Before: As you can see the sort is set here and the URL search params reflect that
![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51036481/230226827-204db228-e95c-4685-8b48-b8c6cb2d04e6.png)

### After: The sort search params are no longer in the URL and the table/list isn't sorted
![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51036481/230226836-1513fc79-76b0-4c9b-ac95-ef7ad216db21.png)

### Desktop

- Mac OS 13.2.1
- Chrome Version 111.0.5563.146
- @refinedev/core version 4.5.2

### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

I'm not sure if this is relevant but this might have something to do with the deprecation of `sorter` that changed to `sorters`.

issue_title: [BUG] Critical vulnerability in the @refinedev/cli dependencies
[Bug] MUI Inferencer Checkbox import
issue_body:
Hi, thanks for creating this great tool!
I am just starting using it and not sure whether it is something I did wrong or it is a bug. The inferencer seems to generate an incorrect import statement for the list view:
```
import {
    useDataGrid,
    EditButton,
    ShowButton,
    DeleteButton,
    List,
    Checkbox,
} from "@refinedev/mui";
```
The error: TS2305: Module '"@refinedev/mui"' has no exported member 'Checkbox'.

Replacing with the following seems to fix it:
`import Checkbox from '@mui/material/Checkbox';`

_Originally posted by @anmnev in https://github.com/refinedev/refine/discussions/3046#discussioncomment-5527139_

issue_title: [BUG] `useModalForm`/ `useForm` from `@refinedev/react-hook-form` with Hasura/GraphQL creates mutation query without id
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

When the useModalForm is used to update resource data, the resulting mutation query in GraphQl is incorrect as it does not contain ID field. 

### Steps To Reproduce

I created a reproducible example here:
[Github Repo](https://github.com/mayurdhurpate/refine-useform-issue-repro)

issue_title: [FEAT] Inferring from empty resources
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Hi folks

As far as I can tell, the inferencer cannot work without at least one record being present in the tables.

Is there any way at all to indicate to the server that the resource is being probed, eg have the inferencer set a header to let the server know that it's being probed and to send a temporary example resource if none are available at the requested URI?

I'd like to use this library in a project where end users will potentially delete all of a particular resource. I'd like them to still be able to add items when this happens.

Thank you

issue_title: [FEAT] Improve `useParsed` through the ability to add Generic Types
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Currently when I'm using `useParsed` there's no option to add generic typing like you can add to `useParams` of React Router V6.

Your current implementation: [packages/core/src/hooks/router/use-parsed/index.tsx](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blob/3ec08ea2ec9a2c187f5b6d5df55e67c72bc8cf3e/packages/core/src/hooks/router/use-parsed/index.tsx)

Router Bindings for V6: [packages/react-router-v6/src/bindings.tsx#L87](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blob/next/packages/react-router-v6/src/bindings.tsx#L87)

In the current version of Refine:
```tsx
const parsedParams = useParsed();
const { locale_id, provider_id } = parsedParams.params as any;
```

What you would want to do:
```tsx
const { locale_id, provider_id } = useParsed<{ params: { locale_id: string; provider_id: string } }>();
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

The current alternative seems to be to use the following solution:

```tsx
import { useParams } from 'react-router-dom';
...
const { locale_id, provider_id } = useParams<{ locale_id: string; provider_id: string }>();
```

### Additional context

I stumbled across this while searching for a solution for composite-primary-keys (CPK), which makes sense since we have lots of tables that have "i18n" clone-tables which have three primary keys. To access this information I need to have a route like: `/post/:id/:locale_id/:provider_id`

### Describe the thing to improve

Currently we're missing type-safety for the sake of simplicity. React Router V6 does this is a good manner, where you can pass a generic to `useParams`. Maybe we can teach `useParsed` this as well?

Implementation reference: [react-router/lib/hooks.tsx#L257](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/blob/main/packages/react-router/lib/hooks.tsx#L257)

issue_title: [DOC] consider getting rid of Discord Help channel
issue_body:
### Documentation issue

As a developer I see Q&A sections of any technology as a documentation, so let it be [DOC].
Please consider stickeing to Github Discussions instead of Discord help channel, because discord saved data is not parcable through search engines and developers have to search for similar problems twice: on Google and on Discord. And this is if they know that Discord exists)

### Describe the thing to improve

I have nothing against discord as a communication platform, you might wanna keep it, to be more open to the community.
But the questions and answers may be useful for other developers. Moreover, often in Discord thread you ask to create an issue, while on Github you could just convert a discussion into issue with one click.
Also you're loosing precions SEO points for number of mentions and all that marketing stuff.

### Describe the solution (optional)

Close the discord help channel with explanation and with redirect to github discussions.

issue_title: [FEAT] base path for resources
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

We have our refine application hostet with some path prefix. i.e: /admin/users, /admin/posts.
Currently we need to define the prefix "/admin" on every resource path. otherwise i.e:
`<NavigateToResource resource="users" />` would redirect to /users instead of /admin/users

```
resources={[
        {
          name: "users",
          list: basePath + "/users",
          show: basePath + "/users/show/:id",
        },
        {
          name: "posts",
          list: basePath + "/posts",
          show: basePath + "/posts/show/:id",
        },
      ]}
```



### Describe alternatives you've considered

Would be awesome to set some prefix for all resources.

### Additional context

We cant set the basePath on the router, since we also have one router for multiple apps. so there is another app without any refine i.e on path /dashboard

"@refinedev/core": "4.5.0",
"@refinedev/react-router-v6": "4.1.0",
"@refinedev/react-table": "5.1.0",

### Describe the thing to improve

add some config property to make this configurable in one place

issue_title: [BUG] Clicking logout adds invalid redirect url to the query string
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

When clicking `logout` button I noticed that some strange redirect url is added to the query string.

It looks like that:
```
http://localhost:3000/login?to=%2Flogin
```

It causes issues because when using `redirectTo` in `authProvider` `login` method, the `redirectTo` parameter is ignored. Instead it uses `/login` from url.




### Steps To Reproduce

1. Add custom redirection in `login` method of `authProvider`.
```
return {
  success: true,
  redirectTo: "/xxx",
};
```
2. Click "logout"
![Screenshot 2023-03-20 at 12 45 25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17653648/226330106-2b34cd3d-2e37-4c5a-95b1-e7721116b41e.png)
3. Look at the url.
4. Login again.
5. You are NOT redirected to `/xxx`.

### Expected behavior

User should be redirected to `/xxx`.

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Desktop

_No response_

### Mobile

### Additional Context

When wrapping a page component with Authenticated component, that page is never rendered. It seems that Authenticated component is in loop.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Unzip **authenticated_sample.zip**
2. Open  **authenticated_sample** folder
3. Run yarn install
4. Run yarn start
5. Login with **admin** user and **dummy** password
6. See that posts page is not rendered

### Expected behavior

Authenticated component should validate if the user is authenticated or not and when it is, posts page should be shown.

issue_title: [BUG] Controller being imported incorrectly from @refinedev/react-hook-form
[BUG] incorrect import of RefineRoutes for Next.js appDir
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

RefineRoutes is defined in `packages/nextjs-router/src/app/refine-routes.tsx`. 
However it is not imported by `packages/nextjs-router/src/app/index.ts`, nor listed in the package.json as file which can be imported by external packages.

https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blob/next/packages/nextjs-router/src/app/index.ts#L5
```ts
export { RefineRoutes } from "../pages/refine-routes";
```

### Steps To Reproduce

1. `import { RefineRoutes } from '@refinedev/nextjs-router/app'` in a Next.js project using the appDir functionality.
2. "Router not mounted" error is thrown by Next.js because the incorrect `RefineRoutes` from `@refinedev/nextjs-router/pages` is loaded.

### Expected behavior

Correct resource page is shown by using `RefineRoutes`.

### Screenshot

issue_title: [FEAT] Support passing metadata to default `RefreshButton`
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

i am using `@pankod/refine-antd` and have custom `metaData` in `useShow`. But inside `Show` component, the `metaData` is'nt passed to the `RefreshButton` 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Using `headerButtons` and adding on top of `defaultButtons` works for now, but we will have 2 `RefreshButton` or we can recreate the whole `defaultButtons`  and passing the `metaData` to `RefreshButton` also works, but it might be easier if we can pass it to `Show` instead

### Describe the thing to improve

We may pass the `metaData` to `Show` and then pass it to `RefreshButton` for a quick solution.

Long term solution might be using `React.createContext` to create something like `MetadataProvider` and then it will be consumed by all relevant components like `RefreshButton`, `DeleteButton`

issue_title: [BUG] Refine CLI not supported in yarn monorepos
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

Since yarn workspaces use the root `node_modules` dir of the project instead of individual ones per package, 
refine CLI fails to resolve the `.bin` directory, because it's expected to be in the current directory relative to the package.json where `refine` is called.

The problem seems to be here https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blob/next/packages/cli/src/commands/runner/projectScripts.ts#L3

It fails to find `./node_modules/.bin/next`
```
@app/admin:dev: Error: Command failed with ENOENT: /usr/src/app/packages/admin/node_modules/.bin/next dev
@app/admin:dev: spawn /usr/src/app/packages/admin/node_modules/.bin/next ENOENT
```

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a new refine nextjs app, called e.g. `my-admin`
2. Remove the package-lock.json and node_modules of the new refine app
3. Move it inside a yarn monorepo (Yarn Berry or not, I think it's not important)
4. Run `yarn install`
5. Run `yarn workspace my-admin run refine dev`

### Expected behavior

The NextJS app should be started in dev mode.

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Desktop

_No response_

### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

[BUG] TypeError: cyclic object value, while using access control cerbos.
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

The problem occurred when trying to use cerbos as access control. The problem doesn't occur when used cerbos without icon in resource but occurs when we use custom icon for our resources. 

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Install any icons library for example `@ant-design/icons`, or `react-icons`
2. Use icon on the resource as 
 
     ````
    <Refine
    // other options 
    accessControlProvider={{
      can: async ({ action, params, resource }) => {
          const result = await cerbos.checkResource({
              principal: {
                  id: "123", // Fake a user ID
                  roles: [role],
                  policyVersion: "default",
                  // this is where user attributes can be passed
                  attributes: {},
              },
              resource: {
                  kind: resource,
                  policyVersion: "default",
                  id: params?.id + "" || "new",
                  attributes: params,
              },
              // the list of actions on the resource to check authorization for
              actions: [action],
          });
          return Promise.resolve({
              can: result.isAllowed(action) || false,
          });
      },
    }}
    resources={[
      {
          name: "posts",
          list: PostList,
          icon: <StepBackwardOutlined />,
      }
    ]}
    />
    ```
3. Now run the project and check the console you will get an error as 
    ```
    Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: cyclic object value

issue_title: [BUG] Invalidating custom queries using custom querykey raised TypeError: this is undefined
issue_body:

While trying to invalidate a query using a custom `queryKey` I got an error as `TypeError: this is undefined`.

### Steps To Reproduce

```
const {} = useCustom({
    method: "get",
    url: "https://api.fake-rest.refine.dev/posts",
    queryOptions: {
        queryKey: ["custom-key"],
    },
});
```

2. Then try to invalidate the above custom query.
```
const { invalidateQueries } = useQueryClient();
invalidateQueries(["custom-key"]);
```

issue_title: [FEAT]: add new properties to `useDrawerForm` hook
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. In `@pankod/refine-antd`package, `useDrawerForm` is similar to `useModalForm` hook. However, `useDrawerForm` does not have `defaultVisible`, `autoSubmitClose`, and `autoResetForm` properties. I think these properties should be added to `useDrawerForm` hook. ### Describe alternatives you've considered _No response_ ### Additional context Similar properties are available in `useModalForm` hook in `@pankod/refine-react-table` package. You can see the [useModalForm](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blob/next/packages/react-hook-form/src/useModalForm/index.ts) hook for more information.
You can see the [contribution guide](https://refine.dev/docs/contributing/) for more information. ### Describe the thing to improve - [ ] `useDrawerForm` hook should have `defaultVisible` property. It will be used to set the initial visibility of the drawer. - [ ] `useDrawerForm` hook should have `autoSubmitClose` property. It will be used to close the drawer after the form is submitted. - [ ] `useDrawerForm` hook should have `autoResetForm` property. It will be used to reset the form after the form is submitted. You can find more information about these properties in [useModalForm](https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/antd/hooks/form/useModalForm/#properties) hook documentation.

issue_title: [BUG] Date inference too sensitive
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

Hi :)

In one of my resources I have a string field that for some reason the Inferencer recognizes as a date field.
The field values can be, for example: "112312", "551351", "34223", "2222" etc. The sole rule of this field that I can say for sure is that it is a string representation of a number with minimum 4 letters.

It gets inferred as date and so gives values such as "12/01/1123," "01/01/3333", "02/02/202" etc.

### Steps To Reproduce

Not really sure what triggers this, but perhaps the value the Inferencer tries to infer from is at a length that seems reasonable for the inferring to be date; or even that when a string is only numbers the inferring is automatically date.

Anyway the reproduction is having a field of type string with number values with length of at least 4 letters.

### Expected behavior

Should be inferred as string or number, not date.

issue_title: [BUG] refine-graphql package unable to fetch data from custom graphql servers
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

Unable to use custom GraphQL server in refine at all, after digging deep into your tutorials...

Errors:
`POST body missing, invalid Content-Type, or JSON object has no keys.`

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Get an empty refine app as boilderplate
2. Install `@pankod/refine-graphql`
3. Provide this URL (custom graphql server) https://nest-graphql-prisma-g5s7.onrender.com/graphql to initialise `GraphQLClient` from `@pankod/refine-graphql`
4. Use the following codeblock to initialise the `List of Payments` (where `Payment` is an entity from my custom GraphQL API)

```ts
<RefineSnackbarProvider>
  <Refine
    dataProvider={dataProvider(client)}
    Layout={Layout}
    ReadyPage={ReadyPage}
    catchAll={<ErrorComponent />}
    routerProvider={routerProvider}
    notificationProvider={notificationProvider}
    resources={[
      {
        name: "Payment",
        list: MuiListInferencer,
        show: MuiShowInferencer,
      },
    ]}
  />
</RefineSnackbarProvider>
```

Then, start your refine app, you'll see on the UI it says `Something went wrong while fetching the resource data.`

### Expected behavior

I expect my app to be showing a list of `Payments` in a table

### Screenshot

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53138432/219922699-f19cd263-ac49-4887-88e0-838d7dc22c7a.png)


### Desktop

_No response_

### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

I suspect the issue is caused by your `dataProvider` is not using `queries` that match the GraphQL schema on my server.

For e,g:
When `refine` executed queries, the query body is `query: "query ($sort: String, $where: JSON, $start: Int, $limit: Int) { payment (sort: $sort, where: $where, start: $start, limit: $limit)  }`, but the schema on `payments` resolver has a different set of query argument which are: `where`, `orderBy`, `skip` and `take`

You can inspect my custom schema on my GraphQL playground: https://nest-graphql-prisma-g5s7.onrender.com/graphql
Feel feel to check out my code of my API if that'll help: https://github.com/Mingyang-Li/nest-graphql-prisma/

issue_title: Removing `hasPagination` property in favor of `pagination` property
issue_body:
The motivation behind the `hasPagination` property was to introduce a way to disable pagination in a non-breaking way. Now with a major version, we can move this same check to `pagination` property since with `hasPagination` set to `false`, `pagination` will not be used. Instead of `hasPagination`, we can do `pagination.enabled: false` to disable pagination.

## Implementation

- Remove `hasPagination` property from `useList` hook.
- Add checks for `pagination.enabled: false` instead of `hasPagination`. (or `disabled: true`)
- Deprecate `hasPagination` property in data providers `getList` but keep it working until the next major version.
- Update docs and examples to reflect the changes.

issue_title: Renaming `metaData` properties to `meta`
issue_body:
We should rename `metaData` to `meta` since there's no need to have a longer name for it and developers are more familiar with the word `meta` and its purpose.

## Implementation

- rename all appearances of `metaData` to `meta` in the codebase.
- Update all documentation to reflect the change.
- Fix the conflicting `meta` property of `useLog` of audit log provider to `logMeta` or something similar.
- Create a `codemod` script to handle the change.

issue_title: Additional Properties in `resource` definitions
issue_body:
We're not sure if we're going to keep the `resources` but if we decide to keep it in `<Refine />` component or keep it but use it in a different place, we should consider adding the ability to pass additional properties to the `resource` definitions. This will allow users to have better control in their `router` handling and other functions if we expose them in the future.

## Implementation

- Add `meta` property to `resource` interface just like `metaData` in data hooks.
- Add examples of use cases.
- Update docs to reflect the changes.

```
This bug is present on repositories example antd from created with `npm create refine-app@latest`.

This bug is a problem from NextJS that does not by default transpile node_modules packages. So in case of some external modules does not export transpiled package this bug occur.

I have fixed this bug by adding the antd packages to the `next.config.js` file.
```
  transpilePackages: [

issue_title: Adding Audit Log to `many` hooks
issue_body:
Even though the audit logging is already available in singular hooks, we've postponed the implementation of this to the `many` hooks to a next major release because of the may-be-breaking change in its implementation.

## Implementation

- We need to add the `log` function to the many hooks depending on their data provider implementation.
- For example, if the data provider implements a `updateMany` method, we need to log the event in the `useUpdateMany` hook in a single transaction.
- If the data provider doesn't implement a `updateMany` method, we need to log the event in the `useUpdateMany` hook in multiple transactions, one for each updated record.

issue_title: Setting `hasPagination` to `false` by default in `useSelect` and derivatives
issue_body:
In most of the cases, pagination is not requested by the user. So, we can set `hasPagination` to `false` by default in `useSelect` and its derivatives.

## Implementation

- We need to check if this has any breaking changes in derivations of `useSelect` hook.
- Set `hasPagination` to `false` by default in `useSelect`.
- Update the documentation.
- Update the examples.

issue_title: Fixing the `defaultValue` issue in `useSelect` and all its derivatives
issue_body:
The `useSelect` hook is working properly except for one thing: the `defaultValue` prop. In UI packages, `useSelect` derivatives are not sending the `defaultValue` prop but accepting it. First, we need to catch this bug in our tests then fix it.

## Implementation

- Add proper test cases to `useSelect` that checks if the `defaultValue` is properly used and set.
- Fix the bug in `useSelect` and all its derivatives.

issue_title: Renaming/Reorganizing Hook Properties
issue_body:
We have some small differences between data hooks about configuration properties they accept, such as pagination, filters and sorting properties are nested inside `config` in `useList` hook but not in `useTable` hook. 

- `config` in `useList` and `useInfiniteList`
- `sort` in data hooks should be renamed to `sorters`
- `resourceName` in `useExport` and `useImport`

## Implementation

- Let's find out all the inconsistencies.
- Update them in non-breaking way. Easiest is to deprecate but keep the old ones working for a major version.
- Update the docs and examples to reflect the changes.

issue_title: tutorial: unit3, p3, query-string version issue
[BUG] ChakraUIEditInferencer treats number fields as strings when edited
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

An example of the generated code is 

```ts
<FormControl mb="3" isInvalid={!!(errors as any)?.outstanding_amount}>
        <FormLabel>Outstanding Amount</FormLabel>
        <Input
          type="number"
          {...register("outstanding_amount", {
            required: "This field is required"
          })}
        />
        <FormErrorMessage>
          {(errors as any)?.outstanding_amount?.message as string}
        </FormErrorMessage>
      </FormControl>
```

The `<input>` type is correctly set to `number` but when the user edits the field the value sent to the server is actually of a `string` type. 

### Steps To Reproduce

Use ChakraUIEditInferencer to generate a UI

### Expected behavior

The generator should accommodate number types

This can be solved by adding `valueAsNumber: true` to the register options, like so 

```ts
      <FormControl mb="3" isInvalid={!!(errors as any)?.outstanding_amount}>
        <FormLabel>Outstanding Amount</FormLabel>
        <Input
          type="number"
          {...register("outstanding_amount", {
            required: "This field is required",
            valueAsNumber: true,
          })}
        />
        <FormErrorMessage>
          {(errors as any)?.outstanding_amount?.message as string}
        </FormErrorMessage>
      </FormControl>
```

issue_title: [BUG]: Property 'component' does not exist on type 'IntrinsicAttributes`...
[FEAT] Custom ID for resources
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Hi,

Most of my resources have their PKs not as "id", but as some other custom "x-id", like "resourceId".
The Inferencer has a hard-coded assumption that the PK is "id", and so my resources aren't properly inference-d.

In most use-cases this is probably a non-issue because we can get the generated code and paste it to a specialized component and simply replace the "id" in this component. But my use-case is perhaps special, because I'm using the Inferencer generically and not taking the code it inferences; so I can't edit the code and use my custom ids instead of "id", i.e. I'm 100% relying on the Inferencer code.


### Describe alternatives you've considered

The reason I'm raising this issue, albeit perhaps only supporting a special case, is that I believe the fix might be quite easy - passing a prop for the id, instead of using hard-coded value "id". Obviously there will be a default value "id", but if the prop is given then use it instead.

This will probably be helpful for most other use-cases where we simply want the Inferencer to work properl in dev environment.

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

As mentioned, I believe passing a prop for the Inferencer for PK would solve this issue.

issue_title: [BUG] Nested CrudFilters with Supabase not correctly mapped
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

Queries nested in `or` filters are not mapped to the respective type with the Supabase `dataProvider`.

Consider the following filter:

```ts
const filter: CrudFilter = {
  operator: 'or',
  value: [
    {
      field: 'name',
      operator: 'contains',
      value: 'test',
    },
  ],
};
```

which should resolve resolve to `(name.ilike.test)` but does resolve to `(name.contains.test)` resulting in

```json
{
    "code": "PGRST100",
    "details": "unknown single value operator contains",
    "hint": null,
    "message": "\"failed to parse logic tree ((name.contains.test))\" (line 1, column 18)"
}
```

issue_title: [BUG] Strapi provider doesn't work well when searching for a null value
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

Hi, I'm using Ant Design's  `Table` and `FilterDropdown` to make a table filter. When there's empty value (null in strapi), it calls the strapi backend with `http://localhost:1337/api/posts?filters[content][$eq]=null`, which will cause Strapi a 500 error. For querying null value, it should use something like `http://localhost:1337/api/posts?filters[content][$null]=true`, or `http://localhost:1337/api/posts?filters[content][$eq]=`.
Is there any way to get around it?

An alternative way would be, set the filter to an empty string. However currently if the filter is empty string, it clears all searches

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Build a content type with nullable fields in Strapi
2. Build a page which contains an Ant Design Table, and set a FilterDropdown for that field, with null value as an option
3. Apply the filter with null value

### Expected behavior

Strapi provider should handle null value searches without causing error

issue_title: [FEAT] Graphql - configurable mutation InputType
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

In `create` and `update` mutation queries, `operation` name can be configured via `metadata`. `variable.input.type` can't be configured as it's "hard coded". 

There is case (or at list mine ;)), where `InputType.type` can't be the same as the "hardcoded by refine" ones.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

For example, in the [dataProvider.create](https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blob/master/packages/graphql/src/dataProvider/index.ts#L125), and in the same spirit that allow to configure `operation` : 
```
const operation = metaData?.operation ?? camelCreateName;
```
The variables.input.type should be something like: 
```
const variableInputType = metaData?.variableInputType ?? `${camelCreateName}Input`
```

What do you think about that ? Is it doable ? 
Thanks for this great piece of lib !

issue_title: [FEAT] Support cursor based pagination in table component
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

The underlying data that I have with my `dataProvider` periodically changes and the current offset-based pagination doesn't provide any guarantee of consistency. Instead of offset-based pagination, I want to pick a column (usually PK but not always integer / long) and filter based on that column with a cursor in the table component. Here are some use-cases where offset pagination is considered harmful. [1])(https://uxdesign.cc/why-facebook-says-cursor-pagination-is-the-greatest-d6b98d86b6c0), [2](https://dev.to/appwrite/this-is-why-you-should-use-cursor-pagination-4nh5)use cases

### Describe alternatives you've considered

If my table has a primary column that is integer/long, I can use `offset` in a way similar to cursor pagination but this approach doesn't work if the primary key is timestamp, string or a composite key. Also, even if the primary key is integer/long, the UX is not good as the values might be sparse instead of being incremental and continuous.

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

An interface in `dataProvider` that lets me provide a cursor value. Material UI already supports it out of the box: https://mui.com/x/react-data-grid/pagination/#cursor-implementation

issue_title: [BUG] DataGrid not changing loading state when mutating or invalidating data
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

I am using a DataGridPro with row reordering functionality. Whenever I reorder rows I store new order into state and show a "Save new order" button. When user clicks this button I do the following:
1. Run a customMutation using `useCustomMutation` to send new row order to backend.
2. After that I invalidate query result using "useInvalidate". This way I'm trying to tell refine that this data needs to be refetched.

<details>
<summary>Overall screenshot</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42899786/211651052-d5c504a0-3931-403e-a3fe-b6f295b9eb2d.png)

Pleaase don't mind red lines, it was about another issue.
</details>

What happens is that when I call `invalidate` I expect `useDataGridProps().dataGridProps.isLoading` property to switch from false to true, but this does not happen. Instead, my DataGrid simply gets silently updated without any loading indication.

I've asked this in Discord(https://discord.com/channels/837692625737613362/1062412321642786816), and @omeraplak helped and pointed that it might be a bug here: 
https://github.com/refinedev/refine/blob/next/packages/mui/src/hooks/useDataGrid/index.ts#L310

Probably that "else" block in ternary should be `isFetching` instead of `!isFetched`.
I could make a PR, but it can be a wrong assumption, so I'd better not.

### Steps To Reproduce

Described in description.

Except you don't really need to have DataGridPro component, simply add some invalidation to your resource list by button click, that would be enough to see the behaviour.

### Expected behavior

DataGrid shows loading progress when data (or resource) it's using get's invalidated and (re-)fetched.

### Screenshot

Added above.

### Desktop

Not platform-specific.

### Mobile

Not platform-specific.

### Additional Context

_No response_

issue_title: [FEAT] Reduce bundle size in Next.js (with Material UI)
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

The bundle size of my Refine app built with Next.js and Material UI is very big and the app is very slow:
```
┌   /_app                                  0 B             551 kB
├ λ /[[...refine]]                         249 B           551 kB
└ ○ /404                                   184 B           551 kB
+ First Load JS shared by all              551 kB
  ├ chunks/framework-305dbdef56d67aa9.js   45.4 kB
  ├ chunks/main-a8eaa706e962a5d6.js        27.9 kB
  ├ chunks/pages/_app-1e8eb2bf899090b0.js  476 kB
  └ chunks/webpack-44567bfec3a37904.js     1.05 kB
```
I think there is room for improvement.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

1.Out of curiosity, I removed the resource pages from the `_app.tsx` file to see the results. It significantly reduced the bundle size:
```
┌   /_app                                  0 B             292 kB
├ λ /[[...refine]]                         249 B           292 kB
└ ○ /404                                   184 B           292 kB
+ First Load JS shared by all              292 kB
  ├ chunks/framework-305dbdef56d67aa9.js   45.4 kB
  ├ chunks/main-a8eaa706e962a5d6.js        27.9 kB
  ├ chunks/pages/_app-432b4edb6ea69894.js  217 kB
  └ chunks/webpack-44567bfec3a37904.js     1.05 kB
```
The fact that I have to import all resource pages in the `_app.tsx` file to pass them to `<Refine>` has a significant effect on the bundle size and speed of my app. I wish there was a way to at least lazy load them.

2. I have to import Material UI components using named imports:
```ts
import { Button } from "@pankod/refine-mui";
``` 
But the [Material UI docs suggests](https://mui.com/material-ui/guides/minimizing-bundle-size/) to import the components using default imports to improve bundle size in dev mode:
```ts
import Button from "@pankod/refine-mui/Button";
```
This is not possible with `@pankod/refine-mui` because it only re-exports mui components with named export.

3. Next.js recently introduced a new compiler option, `modularizeImports` that automatically converts named imports to default imports:
```ts
// before:
import { Delete } "@mui/icons-material"
// after:
import Delete "@mui/icons-material/Delete"
```
To enable it I just need to add this to my `next.config.js`:
```js
module.exports = {
  modularizeImports: {
    "@mui/icons-material": {
      transform: "@mui/icons-material/{{member}}",
    },
  },
};
```
This is very handy for packages like `@mui/icons-material`. It significantly reduces the compile time in dev mode. It doesn't effect the production build because `@mui/icons-material` is side-effect free (at least this is what I've been told, I don't have deep knowledge about how bundles work).
It also could be used with `@mui/material` but not your version of mui (`@pankod/refine-mui/`) so 1) we can't reduce compile time in dev mode with this option 2) it potentially effects the production build because `@pankod/refine-mui` is not side-effect free(?)

Again, I'm not very familiar with this topic. These are just my raw thoughts.

I'm willing to do anything I can do to help you on this because I'm currently blocked by this.

issue_title: [BUG] Warning "Something went wrong when trying to get installed 'refine' packages."
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

When a refine project is created inside a monorepo with workspace feature enabled, the following warning appear when `refine dev` is executed: `Something went wrong when trying to get installed refine packages.`.

### Steps To Reproduce

- Create a blank project (not refine, but npm init)
- Go to the package.json and add the following key:
```
"workspaces": [
  "apps/*"
]
```
- Create and go to apps dir
- Create a refine project with `npm create refine-app@latest refine-app` using next.js + yarn
- Go to refine-app dir
- Run `yarn dev`
- See `Something went wrong when trying to get installed 'refine' packages.` on the console

### Expected behavior

Get the package list correctly and don't see the warning.

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Desktop

OS: Linux Mint
CLI version = 1.13.0


### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

When refine project is created inside a monorepo, some packages are hoisted to the root and `npm ls` command throws an error marking some packages as `UNMET DEPENDENCY`, but the json with all the packages is returned. When you run `refine dev` an warning appear: `Something went wrong when trying to get installed refine packages.`. `yarn list` doesn't throw this, but yarn isn't an viable option for all the projects, we could ignore the npm error and get the package list.

issue_title: [BUG] Font family override does not work
[BUG] wrong mapping of case-insensitive CRUD operators for Strapi-V4
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

The $contains operator should be case-insensitive and $containss case-sensitive according to refine documentation of the CRUD operators
https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/core/interfaceReferences/#crudoperators
This mapping is opposite to strapi-v4 documentation:
https://docs.strapi.io/developer-docs/latest/developer-resources/database-apis-reference/rest/filtering-locale-publication.html#filtering

E.g., if one uses $containss (case-sensitive) with strapi-V4 data provider, this operator is mapped to $containsi (i for insensitive in Strapi naming convention)

### Steps To Reproduce

Any use of $contains, $containss, $ncontains or $ncontainss lead the a wrong operator mapping.

### Expected behavior

The following mapping should apply:
Refine = Strapi
- $contains = $containsi
- $containss = $constains
- $ncontains = $notContainsi
- $ncontainss = $notContains

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Desktop

_No response_

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

issue_title: [BUG] Material-UI createTheme does not expose MuiDataGrid
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

If one wants to customize the DataGrid via the main theme, Typescript throws an error because MuiDataGrid is not present in the components object of the Theme object. The @mui/x-data-grid docs recommend [adding a type augmentation](https://mui.com/x/react-data-grid/getting-started/#typescript), but since the createTheme that we get is from the refine library and not mui directly, we can't use the augmentation.

As a workaround, setting the object passed to createTheme as any allows us to style the DataGrid, but we lose Typescript for it.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a theme via the `@pankod/refine-mui`-exposed `createTheme`
2. Use the following structure:
 ```
 components: { 
  MuiDataGrid: {
    styleOverrides: {
      cell: {
        borderBottom: "1px solid black !important"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### Expected behavior

To get Typescript autocomplete for the MuiDataGrid object

issue_title: [BUG] Can't serve the app from a subdirectory
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

I exactly followed your instructions on [`Serving the application from a subdirectory`](https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/core/providers/router-provider/#serving-the-application-from-a-subdirectory) (with react-location) but it didn't work. Another guy who I believe is a core team member confirmed that it's a bug in [`discord`](https://discord.com/channels/837692625737613362/1019855665633706044/threads/1051820059867234324)

Here is the bug report that I posted on discord:

I want the base path of my app be `/admin/`. So for example the users list page would be `/admin/users`. I followed your instructions : `Serving the application from a subdirectory`
I have a `CustomRouterComponent` component:
```ts
const { RouterComponent, location } = routerProvider;

const CustomRouterComponent = () => (
  <RouterComponent location={location} basepath="/admin" />
);
```
And I give it to`<Refine>`:
```ts
routerProvider={{
  ...routerProvider,
  RouterComponent: CustomRouterComponent,
}}
```
Now when I open `/admin` it automatically redirects to `/admin/users` which is a good sign but nothing renders on that page and any other page in my app. I don't get any wired error on the console. I don't get a 404. Just nothing renders. All pages are empty.

**I'm using Vite+React+TS+React location**. All of my dependencies all up-to-date. I've also tried to set `base` to `/admin/` in `vite.config.ts` but it didn't help:
```ts
export default defineConfig({
  base: "/admin/",
});
```

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a Refine app with React and React Location
2. Follow the instructions https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/core/providers/router-provider/#serving-the-application-from-a-subdirectory

### Expected behavior

Well, it should work as expected :)

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Desktop

Browser: Chromium 105.0.5195.125 Fedora Project


### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

issue_title: [BUG] Refine Antd + Vite fails in production build
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

I think it's an issue similar to https://bytemeta.vip/repo/rjsf-team/react-jsonschema-form/issues/2962

When building a project with Refine/Antd and Vite there's an error on the browser `generatePickerExports is not a function`. 
It seems that the issue is due to imports from CommonJS modules in AntD and not ESModules as vite requires.

I've patched node_modules/@pankod/refine-antd/dist/esm/index.js to make it work (replacing picker imports from `lib` to `es` and it seem to resolve the issue.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a new refine project with Antd and Vite.
2. Set `  build: {
    minify: false
  },` in `vite.config.ts`.
3. `npm run build`
4. `npm run preview`
5. Open a browser and see the error

### Expected behavior

Production build should work.

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Desktop

- OS: Mac OS 13
- Chrome 108
- Deployment with Vercel

### Mobile

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

issue_title: [DOC] Material UI Tutorial
issue_body:
### Documentation issue

The [Material UI Tutorial](https://refine.dev/docs/tutorials/material-ui-tutorial/) has incorrect directory references for the boilerplate project. 

At ["Create a List Page"](https://refine.dev/docs/tutorials/material-ui-tutorial/#creating-a-list-page), the instructions say to create a directory "interfaces" under "/src". However, the "list.tsx" file calls the interface like it's a library `import { IPost } from "interfaces"` not a relative directory. 

Later in the step, when adding `import { PostList } from "pages/posts"` it's the same issue - that's not a relative file or directory. It's calling it like a library. 

### Describe the thing to improve

Inside "src/pages/posts/list.tsx" revise from `import { IPost } from "interfaces"` to `import { IPost } from "../../interfaces"`.

Inside "src/App.tsx" revise from `import { PostList } from "pages/posts"` to `import { PostList } from "./pages/posts/list"`. 

### Describe the solution (optional)

_No response_

issue_title: [FEAT] Use next.js default compiler SWC
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

The next.js template currently uses babel. Babel is slow. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Vite, but next.js will not support vite natively as they are all-in on swc. 

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

Since next.js 12, the default compiler is swc. https://nextjs.org/docs/advanced-features/compiler This has:

* 3x faster refresh
* 5x faster builds for production
* 17x faster than Babel for compilation

Additionally, it is the main compiler going forward for next.js.

Relay is designed for high performance at any scale. Relay keeps management of data-fetching easy, whether your app has tens, hundreds, or thousands of components. And thanks to Relay’s incremental compiler, it keeps your iteration speed fast even as your app grows

issue_title: [BUG] Duplicate data requests
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

I have followed along the MUI tutorial using latest version of refine. 
Everything works as expected but when I open Chrome dev tools I see for both the list view and the show view duplicate
XHR requests are being fired.



### Steps To Reproduce

1. git clone git@github.com:refinedev/refine.git
2. cd refine/examples/tutorial/mui
3. npm install
4. npm run start
5. Open Chrome and check dev tools network requests for listing posts and showing a single post

### Expected behavior

When the list view is loaded only a single request GET /posts should be fired.
When the show view is loaded only a single request GET /posts/1 should be fired.

issue_title: [DOC] Material UI Server Side validation example.
issue_body:
### Documentation issue

Hi Refine,

I'm trying to display server generated validation errors, specifically I'm pointing refine at a FastAPI endpoint which hands back 422 responses with JSON bodies that look like:
```
{
    "detail": [
        {
            "loc": [
                "path",
                "item_id"
            ],
            "msg": "value is not a valid integer",
            "type": "type_error.integer"
        },
        {
            "loc": [
                "path",
                "item_name"
            ],
            "msg": "value is not a valid string",
            "type": "type_error.string"
        }
    ]
}
```
I've found an issue already that deals with this use case and have gotten to the point where I can catch the error using the `onMutationError` hook, but I can't figure out how to change the Material IU form refine uses to show the errors properly. See here: https://github.com/refinedev/refine/issues/1681

I can't find anywhere in the documentation that gives a good example of how this can be achieved. Can you help?

### Describe the thing to improve

Some examples of how to display custom form validation errors, particularly when kicked off by an `onMutationError` hook.

### Describe the solution (optional)

_No response_

issue_title: Good 😊
[BUG] Issue on redirect url after user is logged out on jwt refresh token expiration.
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

I am using the JWT authentication on my project and it works fine when I log in and save the access token in my local or session storage. But whenever my refresh token is expired and the server responds with 401 status the user gets logged out which is fine. When the user is logged out the redirect URL must be the resource that the user is trying to access instead the redirect URL will be `/login`.  

### Steps To Reproduce

https://stackblitz.com/edit/refinedev-refine-voibwj?file=src/App.tsx

The steps to reproduce the issues is on the above link.

### Expected behavior


For example:
Let us say I am trying to access the **users** resource from the menu but my refresh token is expired then I will be redirected to the login page with the URL as `<domain>/login?to=/login` instead of `<domain>/login?to=/users`

### Screenshot

![login-redirect](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33461005/198755653-366b70a1-1094-44d0-9b0b-a4e8d9215915.png)

issue_title: [FEAT] Add useInfiniteList support
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

For resources that cannot be paginated, the `useInfiniteList` hook will be useful. This hook can use the data provider's "getList" function like the [`useList`](https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/core/hooks/data/useList/) hook. Unlike this hook, [`useInfiniteQuery`](https://tanstack.com/query/v4/docs/reference/useInfiniteQuery) should be used instead of [`useQuery`](https://tanstack.com/query/v4/docs/reference/useQuery?from=reactQueryV3&original=https://react-query-v3.tanstack.com/reference/useQuery).


### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

For resources that cannot be paginated, the `useInfiniteList` hook will be useful.

issue_title: [FEAT] add a property showWhenUnauthorized to <*Button>s
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

I don't want my basic user (customers, mainly) to see buttons related to pages/functions they cannot have access to. The button should not be disables, as they should be hidden 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I can achieve the same behaviour using a `<CanAccess>` component around the `<*Button>`, but that should be (imho) a button feature

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

I'd love to have a prop on the Buttons (`ListButton`, `EditButton`, `ShowButton`, `DeleteButton`) (e.g `showWhenUnauthorized` - default: `true` ) to avoid showing unauthorized buttons **at all**, as they **should not** be clicked by basic users, so it' useless to even show them

issue_title: [BUG] Disable click on <*Button>s when unauthorized
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

Right now my "basic user" should only be able to see (not edit) a list, and its detail. 
Using `<EditButton>` in the List actions column instead makes the button appear as `disabled` (**but still clickable**).

When clicked you're (of course) redirected to a 404 page.

~~I'd also love to have a prop on the Buttons (`ListButton`, `EditButton`, `ShowButton`, `DeleteButton`) (e.g `showWhenUnauthorized` - default: `true` ) to avoid showing unauthorized buttons **at all**, as they **should not** be clicked by basic users, so it' useless to even show them~~



### Steps To Reproduce

1. Setup providers to set "can: false" on some resource/actions
2. Create a `<ShowButton>` or `<EditButton>` for given resource/action
3. Click on the button

### Expected behavior

You should

1- Not be redirected to a 404 page
~~2- (Even better) Not see the disabled button at all (maybe behind a `showWhenUnauthorized` prop)~~

### Screenshot

_No response_

_No response_

issue_title: [FEAT] Breadcrumb options support
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

CRUD components import the `Breadcrumb`([example Ant Design](https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/antd/components/breadcrumb/)) component by default. If we want to hide the breadcrumbs, we must set the `breadcrumb` property of the CRUD components to `false`.
```ts
<Create breadcrumb={false} />
```
example: https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/antd/components/basic-views/create/#breadcrumb

instead, the `breadcrumb` property can be added to the `options` of the [`<Refine />`](https://refine.dev/docs/api-reference/core/components/refine-config/#options-1) component. Thus it is managed globally. The `breadcrumb` property passed to the CRUD component overrides the `options`.


### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

Breadcrumbs in CRUD components are more manageable

issue_title: [FEAT] Dynamic window title
issue_body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

It would be great if each page could have an auto-generated and custom title. 

Example, For the Posts resource

- dashboard -> `Dashboard | refine`
- list -> `Posts | refine`
- edit -> `#{id} Edit Post | refine`
- show -> `#{id} Show Post | refine`
- create -> `Create new Post | refine`

It can also be overridden by adding an event to the refine options.

```
onWindowTitle: ({ resource, action, params, autoGeneratedTitle }) => {
console.log({  resource, action, params, autoGeneratedTitle });
*/
{
  resource: "posts",
  options: { foo: "bar" },
  params: { id: 1, action: "edit" }
  autoGeneratedTitle: "#{1} Edit Post | refine"
} 
*/
}
```

It can also be managed manually with a hook called `useWindowTitle()` or `useDocumentTitle()`
### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Describe the thing to improve

Pages can be easily distinguished in browser history and tabs

issue_title: [BUG] Mantine AuthPage hooks incorrect
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

The AuthPage exported by refine-mantine is calling the useLogin() hook for the Register, ForgotPassword, and UpdatePassword instead of their respective hooks exported from the core library. As a result; filling out the form and submitting on any of these pages will result in the login function being called in the authProvider.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Go to any of the pages (Register, ForgotPassword, UpdatePassword) using the refine-mantine library
2. Fill out the form and submit
3. The login() function in authProvider will be called instead of the expected function

### Expected behavior

Expecting the correct functions inside of the authProvider to be called onSubmit (Register should call register, etc...)

### Screenshot

https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/2d50ce85e2907a8c2345ad26da150ad324ac544c/packages/mantine/src/components/pages/auth/components/forgotPassword/index.tsx#L64-L65

https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/2d50ce85e2907a8c2345ad26da150ad324ac544c/packages/mantine/src/components/pages/auth/components/register/index.tsx#L63

https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/2d50ce85e2907a8c2345ad26da150ad324ac544c/packages/mantine/src/components/pages/auth/components/updatePassword/index.tsx#L61-L62

issue_title: [BUG] Fix eslint warnings on whole examples
issue_body:
### Describe the bug

All examples has a known eslint warning like following:

```tsx
const container = document.getElementById("root");
const root = createRoot(container!); // this line throw null-assertion warning
```

It can be solved like this:

```tsx
const container = document.getElementById("root");
// eslint-disable-next-line
const root = createRoot(container!); // this line throw null-assertion warning
```

Also, some variables, types or functions are declared but not using.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. `npm run bootstrap`
2. `npm run bootstrap -- --scope "example-name"`
3. `npm run start -- --scope "example-name"`
4. Shows eslint warnings and errors in the terminal.

### Expected behavior

The examples run with no lint warnings or errors.

issue_title: [FEAT] Allow passing custom queryClient instance
issue_body:
It's currently not possible to pass a queryClient to refine.

This make invalidating queries from outside react context really hard as this can currently only be done using the `useInvalidate` hook.

Passing your own queryClient would allow sharing the queryClient instance with other parts of the application, even other frameworks.
