issue_title: [BUG] When integrating with Antd, time picker returns time with date
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
When using [time picker](https://ant.design/components/time-picker/#header) from Ant Design, the value of `form.item` is a timestamp which includes time and date. Therefore, when we try to update the value to the database, we get an error : "_invalid input syntax for type time_".

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Refer to [antd example](https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/next/examples/tutorial/antd/src/pages/posts/edit.tsx), replace `<Form.Item>...</Form.Item>` with following codes
```
<Form.Item
   label="Test"
   name="test"
   rules={[
           {
              required: true,
            },
   ]}
>
   <TimePicker size="large" />
</Form.Item>
```
2. Input time using time picker
3. Click "Save"
5. See the value get from time picker is `"2022-09-26T06:00:00.000Z\"` instead of `"06:00:00"`

**Expected behavior**
When we use time picker, we want to get only the time without date so we can update the value to the databse.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/95261974/192269374-8ddc5c10-f44c-4c24-ae3e-7273edfb9f7a.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [iOS]
 - Browser [chrome]
 - Version [refine-antd: "3.41.0"]
 - Used dataProvider [custom]

**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**
 null

**Additional context**
 null

issue_title: [BUG] Sider is breaking the app when submenu items has `icon`
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
When you have a resource with `icon` and `parentName` property, `Sider` is breaking the app with error on `react-query`.

**To Reproduce**
Create a resource with both `icon` and `parentName` properties.

**Expected behavior**
Should render the icon and the menu successfully

**Additional context**
This is happening because we've wrapped the `SubMenu` items in Siders of `antd` and `mui` packages with `CanAccess` component which is a wrapper around the `useCan` hook and this hook uses `useQuery` from `react-query`. We're providing all the parameters we have to the `key` value of the query and this fails to stringify because of the react/html elements if there are any.

issue_title: [BUG] undoable mutation is called many times
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
When updating multiple records at the same time whose mutationMode is `undoable`, the `doMutation()` method is called multiple times leading to duplicate API calls for the dataProvider.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a list page where multiple records are shown.  useUpdate or useUpdateMany works best for this.  Ensure the mutation function for the records defines `mutationMode: "undoable"`
2. Edit one of the records.
3. While the toast message from step 2 is still shown, update different record.
4. While the toast message from step 2 is still shown, update the same record from step 2 _again_

**Expected behavior**
Viewing the network calls made from the browser, you will see that many more API calls to the dataProvider endpoint were executed.  You would expect that with 3 updates made, only 3 API calls would have been performed.

**Screenshots**
I've modified the `refine-advanced-table-example` with the following changes in order to better represent this issue:
1. The "Delete selected items" button is not disabled while waiting for the success of the undoable mutation.
2. The `useDeleteMany` mutation has been changed to `useUpdateMany` so that records are not removed and can be modified multiple times.

I believe these changes provide a more simplistic use case which serves to demonstrate the issue.  Disabling the "Delete selected items" button is definitely a work around for this issue, but a requirement to disable the user from disabling any edit functionality is not clearly mentioned in documentation.


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8311573/191482087-ef33607f-4ea5-4d25-83c6-4bbdec76c850.mov



**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: MacOS
 - Browser chrome
 - Version  105.0.5195.125
 - Used dataProvider [e.g. custom, Strapi, Airtable]

**Additional information**
A possible fix for this is shown here: https://github.com/pankod/refine/compare/next...collinpreston:refine:remove-notificationItem-at-time-zero

issue_title: [BUG] useModalForm doesn't backfill correct generics
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
Summary: Type inference for useModalForm seems to be broken, given below
generic types you would expect the hook to be able to infer and return the correct object;
But the return object as any is returned instead.

Example:
```tsx
	const {
		modalProps: closeModalProps,
		formProps: closeFormProps,
		show: closeModalShow
	} = useModalForm<Account, HttpError, InternalAccountUpdates>({
		action: 'edit',
		metaData: {
			httpMethod: 'patch'
		},
		warnWhenUnsavedChanges: true
	})
```

**Received Types**

`modalProps: any`
`formProps:  any`
`show: any`

**Expected behavior**

`modalProps: ModalProps`
`formProps:  FormProps<InternalAccountUpdates>`
`show: (id?: BaseKey) => void`

**To Reproduce**

Get the latest "@pankod/refine-antd": "^3.46.2" and use useModalForm(),
confirm types are not inferred correctly 

**Deps**

"@pankod/refine-antd": "^3.46.2"
"@pankod/refine-core": "^3.69.6"
"@pankod/refine-kbar": "^0.8.0"
"@pankod/refine-react-router-v6": "^3.33.0"

** Current Dirty(Low Effort) Workaround **

Custom type:
```tsx
type TUseCloseModalReturn = TUseModalFormReturnType<Account, HttpError,InternalAccountUpdates>
	const {
		modalProps: closeModalProps,
		formProps: closeFormProps,
		show: closeModalShow
	}: TUseCloseModalReturn
// assign this to the returned object
// where `TUseCloseModalReturn ===   useCloseModalReturn<_, _, _>` is the imported type from refine lib 
// no changes to the type made inference on the type doesn't seem to be broken
```

issue_title: [FEAT] Catch All / Splat routing for refine in `nextjs` and `remix`
issue_body:
Due to some missing transformations in `useParams` hooks of `@pankod/refine-nextjs-router` and `@pankod/refine-remix-router`, users need to create multiple files in the `pages` or `routes` directories to render **refine** components.

We need to update those to support something like `[[...refine]].tsx` in `nextjs` and `$.tsx` in `remix`.

issue_title: [FEAT] Nested resources/routes in `nextjs` and `remix`
issue_body: Currently, `@pankod/refine-nextjs-router` and `@pankod/refine-remix-router` does not support nested routes; we should add this ability to fully support `refine`s routing features.

issue_title: [FEAT] `refine-react-location` does not support `404` routes.
issue_body: Currently, `@pankod/refine-react-location` does not support fallback routes and redirects to the initial route.

issue_title: [FEAT] add Showguesser component
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
react-admin has a really cool feature called the guesser component here https://marmelab.com/react-admin/ShowGuesser.html
basically this component try guesses (by print js code out to console) what should be show base on the type of prop that passed in,
It would be cool if refine.dev has this component, I use it all the time when I use react-admin, I plan to use refine.dev on a new project and one of the few things I miss from react-admin is the "guesser" feature.
this will enable refine to really do rapid development

**Describe the solution you'd like**

issue_title: [BUG] `useImport` all batches are sent at once instead of one after the other
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
When `useImport` is used with `batchSize` option, it is expected that the batches are sent one **after** another (i.e. next batch is sent to the server **after** the first batch processing completes). However, currently all batches are being sent at once (which is not correct), since it overloads the server with too many requests at the same times, and makes the batching pointless.

**To Reproduce**
Use `useImport` with batchSize as below:
```js
  const { uploadProps, buttonProps, mutationResult, isLoading } = useImport({
    batchSize: 10,
  });
```
and select a large file as upload input. You will seen all the batches being set at once to the server.

**Expected behavior**
Batches should be sent one after another (i.e. after the first one returns, send the next one)

**Additional context**
The code is sending the requests in a map, instead of in a forEach await-loop https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/c1908141d25e38bbd67aa3e9eb755bf538369aba/packages/core/src/hooks/import/index.tsx#L222-L235

issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
I enter a specific resource for useTable. It sends a query with success. But when I press the reset button, it does not remember the resource I entered. It uses the default resource.


**Expected behavior**
useTable should use the resource name when it was first created.


```
"@pankod/refine-antd": "^3.41.0",
"@pankod/refine-core": "^3.69.2",

```

issue_title: [BUG] useMutation Result type has wrong return names
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
If I send a mutation with useStepsForm, the return key is given automatically. 
For example, if I have a page like 'alarm', 
```javascript
return { alarm: { id: result.insertedId.toString() } }; 
```

It should return as . However, the values returned on the client side are captured directly as data.id

 If I use a type converter like https://www.the-guild.dev/graphql/codegen/plugins/typescript/typescript-react-query codegen, on the client side, the type checker asks me to use data.alarm.id. 

Because my Graphql schema is designed in the desired structure in useStepsForm. Codegen converter also converts accordingly.


**Expected behavior**
If there is an automatically created parent object name, it should also be written on the client side.

issue_title: [FEAT] Material UI and Ant Design Sider Component Modification
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
We had to make a custom sider to make minor changes while using both `Material UI` and `Ant Design` `Sider` component. With this feature request, we will be able to modify the top and bottom parts of the sider component by keeping the menu part the same.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
We can add two property to both `Sider` components ( topSection and bottomSection ) to reach and modify these parts. In this way we can remove or replace `Logout` button and also `Dashboard` menu item.

**Additional context**
Example of remove `Logout` button

```
<Refine
    ...
    Sider={<DefaultSider bottomSection={null} />}
    ...
/>;
```

issue_body:
`dataProviderName` prop is not working properly in `useImport` hook.

**Expected behavior**
It should send the request to the specified data provider rather than the default one.

issue_title: [FEAT] **Go To Definition** is not working with source code
issue_body:
In the current structure of the packages, we're not able to use the `Go To Definition` or `Peek Definition` features of the code editors with source code support. It is a burden on our development and is a big hit for the developer experience.

We should update the build scripts accordingly to support declaration maps by `tsc` so we will have source code navigation instead of the build codes.

issue_title: [BUG] Browser back navigation broken with syncWithLocation and paginated useTable
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
Using 'syncWithLocation' within a paginated table breaks the browser back navigation. It gets stuck and reloads the same page over and over. 

Reason for that is propbably, that after loading the previos page refine adds the query parameters back to the URL. By pressing the back button the next time, the browser reloads the same page without the query parmeters -> query parameters are added  again -> and so on...

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://example.admin.refine.dev/products
2. Use the bottom navigation to switch between pages
3. Use the browser back button

**Expected behavior**
The browser loads the previous page (still product page but the the previous pagination page).

**Video**
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/106522540/182851274-aedb6259-408a-454a-9075-dac2bf12ee98.mp4


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows
 - Browser: Chrome & Edge
 - Version: 3.23.0
 - Used dataProvider: useTable

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

issue_title: [DOC] Webpack Polyfills querystring
issue_body:
**Is this issue related to an existing part of the documentation? If so, please provide a link**
Data Providers, specifically the [getMany section.](https://refine.dev/docs/core/providers/data-provider/#getmany)

**Describe the thing to improve**
Causes this error on compile:
```
BREAKING CHANGE: webpack < 5 used to include polyfills for node.js core modules by default.
This is no longer the case. Verify if you need this module and configure a polyfill for it.

If you want to include a polyfill, you need to:
    - add a fallback 'resolve.fallback: { "querystring": require.resolve("querystring-es3") }'
    - install 'querystring-es3'
If you don't want to include a polyfill, you can use an empty module like this:
    resolve.fallback: { "querystring": false }
```

**Describe the solution (optional)**
I typically use Vite for all my front-end related development. So I'm not exactly sure what those are, but it would be nice to follow the documentation without any friction. Maybe an up-to-date snippet of code or extended explanation on what to do with webpack causing problems.

issue_title: [FEAT] Please make the PageHeader extra extensible
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently the views such as `Show`, `Edit`, `Create`, `List` etc. offer default buttons in the PageHeader `extra`. This is good because these default buttons inherit many things such as `recordItemId`, `dataProviderName` etc from the parent view component and auto-configure themselves.

The problem is, when we need to add additional buttons **before** and **after** the default buttons. For example, in the `Show` view I already get a `RefreshButton` by default and would like to add a `Download` button before the built-in Refresh Button.

This requires me to rewrite everything in the PageHeader `extra` (including all the configuration of `recordItemId`, `dataProviderName` etc required for the built-in buttons).

There is no way to just **prepend** and **append** few buttons to the already existing built-in buttons.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

- Kindly allow extra ReactNode contents to be **prepended** and **appended** to the built-in Page Header components (instead of overwriting them)

For example, 
- Should be able to add few `ReactNode`s  **before** the built-in `extra` components and **after** the built-in `extra` components in the `PageHeader`

issue_title: [FEAT] Pass the full resource to the `accessControlProvider` `can` method
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When making use of the `accessControlProvider` for authorization, it would be useful to have access to the full resource object. This will enable Attribute Based Access Control (ABAC), for example granting permissions based on the value of a field in the resource object.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
In the `can` function, pass in the full object as a parameter, rather than just the ID.
```
<Refine
      accessControlProvider={{
        can: async ({ action, params, resource }) => {
```

Users can then make decisions based on any field in the resource.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
You could do a separate call to get the resource again from the backend but that is going to double the load on your service.

**Additional context**
Any ABAC supporting authorization system, such as [Cerbos](https://cerbos.dev), is going to need this.

issue_title: [DOCS] How to generate automatic typescript types from your graphql schema. [Hasura]
issue_body:
**Is this issue related to an existing part of the documentation? If so, please provide a link**
I am not sure about this

**Describe the thing to improve**
A clear and concise description of problems.

**If you are using Hasura as backend service, you may want to generate typescript types for your queries/mutation and use them with refine.** 

**Step 1.** Export graphql schema file from hasura. You can follow this [guide](https://hasura.io/docs/latest/guides/export-graphql-schema/)  

I will use apollo's new `rover cli`. Install apollo rover cli using following command
`npm install --save-dev @apollo/rover`

Generate Graphql schema using the following command.
`npx rover graph introspect http://localhost:8080/v1/graphql -H "X-Hasura-Admin-Secret:adminsecretkey" | out-file  schema.graphql -encoding utf8`

If you are curious about the `-encoding utf8` flag read [here](https://github.com/apollographql/rover/issues/653)

**Step 2.** Generate typescript types from  `schema.graphql` file

Create a file `codegen.yml` in the same level where your `package json` exist

```
schema: schema8.graphql
generates:
  ./src/generated.ts:
    plugins:
      - typescript
      - typescript-operations
      - typed-document-node
```

Install required packages using following command
`npm i -D @graphql-codegen/cli @graphql-codegen/typed-document-node @graphql-codegen/typescript @graphql-codegen/typescript-operations`

My `devDependencies` tree look like this now

```json
"devDependencies": {
    "@apollo/rover": "^0.7.0",
    "@graphql-codegen/cli": "^2.9.1",
    "@graphql-codegen/typed-document-node": "^2.3.2",
    "@graphql-codegen/typescript": "^2.7.2",
    "@graphql-codegen/typescript-operations": "^2.5.2",
    "@types/graphql": "^14.5.0",
    "apollo": "^2.34.0",
    "graphql": "^16.5.0"
  }
```

Add `codegen` script cmd in `package.json` to generate types
```
 "scripts": {
    "start": "react-scripts start",
    "build": "react-scripts build",
    "test": "react-scripts test",
    "eject": "react-scripts eject",
    "codegen": "graphql-codegen --config ./codegen.yml"
  },
```
Now run `npm run codegen` and and new file `generated.ts` will be created inside `src` directory 

This [video ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ob3MRkgQdcc&lc=Ugzk6tTKDjczTlmN-uV4AaABAg.9dkDWH_k8Sm9dnXhQ__En5&ab_channel=JamieBarton)explain more about automatic types from graphql schema 


related [#1713 ](https://github.com/pankod/refine/issues/1713)

Also maybe add `examples/**/node_modules` in the root .gitignore (for people who open just the root directory but `npm i` inside each example).

issue_title: [BUG] Antd useStepsForm uses isBackValidate=true
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
On refine-antd, useStepsForm paramter isBackValidate is set to true by default. 
Maybe, on other libraries, it is set to false by default:  [@pankod/refine-react-hook-form@3.23.0](https://github.com/pankod/refine/releases/tag/@pankod%2Frefine-react-hook-form@3.23.0).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open stepforms code example on stackblitz:
https://refine.dev/docs/examples/form/antd/useStepsForm/
https://stackblitz.com/fork/github/pankod/refine/tree/master/examples/form/antd/useStepsForm?preset=node
2. create post
3. write content on first page and click next
4. click on button previous -> It will say field is required

**Additional context**
If you write useStepForm({isBackValidate:false}) it works.
It seems that reactStepForm catches this parameter isBackValidate from sunflower-antd which default value is false:
https://github.com/ant-design/sunflower/issues/249

issue_title: [BUG] Uncaught (in promise) Error in useForm.ts:150
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
When `useForm` is used and the underlying action results in an error (such as "unauthorized access" 403 etc.), the error is not caught and handled properly, resulting in `Uncaught (in promise) Error` as shown in the screenshot below.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4610831/179881014-b2c25e90-0650-4296-addc-6bf92c1ee331.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4610831/179881208-a97e0a04-d8c6-474a-a1e6-98b295a72106.png)


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. `useForm` with an action "create" and a `Create` view component with a form
2. on submitting the form, let the server return 403 `unAuthorized` error
3. you will see the error logged in console: Uncaught (in promise) Error in useForm.ts:150


**Expected behavior**
Uncaught promise errors are not good for code. Catching and handling this would be good. 

(Note that the client correctly shows the error notification that the server rejected the action. But at the same time this `uncaught promise error` is also logged. Hope to see this error be handled and the client continues to show the error notification as currently happens)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4610831/179882163-c6ebaf1c-043a-4e5e-b40d-b826336a2520.png)

issue_title: [FEAT] `@pankod/refine-antd`s `useTable` and `useSimpleList` does not export `setFilters`
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Users cannot manage filters/params manually when they use `@pankod/refine-antd#useTable` or `@pankod/refine-antd#useSimpleList` because of the missing `setFilters` function from`@pankod/refine-core#useTable`

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Exporting all properties of `refine-core#useTable`'s results.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Workaround can be applied such as updating `permanentFilters` or `initialFilters` or managing `onFinish` manually but not cool.

issue_title: [BUG] `antd@4.21.6` type change breaks `@pankod/refine-antd` builds
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
With `antd@4.21.6`, [`UploadFileStatus`](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/blob/master/components/upload/interface.tsx#L13) interface used in `useFileUploadState` hook is changed. `"removed"` is omitted from the type and causes an error in the switch-case block.

It's not really used by us, it's an empty case. I think it's best to clear the cases with no expression inside to avoid any unrelated errors in the future.

issue_title: [FEAT] Allowing an `options` prop in `<Refine/>` to configure default values/behaviors
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
**refine** API has defaults values in its hooks and helpers which can ben overridden from their parameters but in some cases, user might need to apply their overrides at every usage. For example the default redirect in `useForm` which is set to `edit` (was `list` in older versions).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
An `options` prop to `<Refine/>` component to edit default values (not all of them but the ones most changed). While doing so, we can also move `mutationMode`, `syncWithLocation`, `warnWhenUnsavedChanges`, `undoableTimeout`, `reactQueryClientConfig` and `reactQueryDevtoolConfig` props to `options` (or `config`) for sake of consistency.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Currently, default values can be overridden in place but this can lead to repetition of the same lines over and over in the whole project.

Still not sure what's the best approach here, waiting for comments from the community. Do you have any overrides you do in every usage of a hook or a component? Do you think having a way to change the defaults might work for your case?

issue_title: [FEAT] Have a clear way to propagate errors to forms
issue_body:
I want to be able to provide the form component with the server returned errors in an easy manner

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I'd imagine a `parseErrors`, `transformErrors`, `processErrors` method I could supply `useForm` that would receive the response object and would use the return value (probably an object of structure `{ fieldName: errorText[]} mapping) to set the form errors,

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
currently doing it manually using `onMutationError`, and handling the error object on my own. which doesn't allow me to use `setError` since it's a return value of `useForm`

issue_title: [BUG] Filters using OR comparator are not correctly merged
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Return filter array with top level OR filter from `onSearch` when using `useTable` (setFilterBehavior should be 'merge')
2. Note that each time the filter is changed it is appended to filter array passed to `DataProvider` (instead of replacing existing)

**Expected behavior**
Changing this filter and returning from `onSearch` should replace the filter when passed down to `DataProvider` through `useTable` internals

issue_title: [BUG] MUI showButton not working since @pankod/refine-mui v3.32.0
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
A previously working app using `showButton` from `@pankod/refine-mui v3.32.0` suddenly stopped working when the dependency was updated to the latest version with the error:

> Unhandled Runtime Error
> Error: Failed prop type: The prop `href` expects a `string` or `object` in `<Link>`, but got `undefined` instead.
> Open your browser's console to view the Component stack trace.

After testing with several versions, it looks to me this started happening in the change from `3.32.0` to `3.34.0` (seems like `Link` behaviour was changed in that patch). 

The implementation of the button itself is exactly as shown in the docs:

```typescript
<ShowButton hideText size="small" recordItemId={record.id} />
```

Where `record.id` always exists.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Implement MUI's `showButton` as shown in the docs using `@pankod/refine-mui v3.32.0`
2. Verify it's working as intended
3. Upgrade `@pankod/refine-mui` to `v3.34.0` or later
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
Page should display the `showButton` correctly.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: macOS
 - Browser Chrome
 - Version 103.0.5
 - Used dataProvider: simple-rest

issue_title: [BUG] refreshButton is asking for default dataProvider
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
On a `show` view page, we are using show with custom `dataProviderName` as below:
````
  const { queryResult } = useShow({ dataProviderName: "xyz" });

  return <Show isLoading={isLoading} > some content </show>

````
This is resulting in below error from `RefreshButton`. The `RefreshButton` is not considering the `useShow`'s  dataProviderName, instead looking for `default` data provider.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4610831/177247586-5f46d83c-1293-45b4-8127-df17bbd53af3.png)

Providing the `RefreshButton` manually as below avoids the errors, but it does not take advantage of in-built buttons of the `show` component. I have to write all those buttons code again explicitly.
```
    <Show isLoading={isLoading} 
       pageHeaderProps={{ 
         extra: <RefreshButton dataProviderName="xyz" onClick={() => queryResult.refetch()} /> }}>

```

All of this code duplication just to provide custom dataProviderName for the RefreshButton.

Q: can RefreshButton take `useShow`'s dataProviderName by default?
------------------

**To Reproduce**
Use Refine with custom data provider as below:
```
    <Refine
      dataProvider={{
        xyz: dataProvider("https://api.fake-rest.refine.dev"),
      }}
```
and on your show view, use code as below:
```
  const { queryResult } = useShow({ dataProviderName: "xyz" });

  return <Show isLoading={isLoading} > some content </show>
```
You will start to see the errors

issue_title: [FEAT] Differentiate between refetch() and normal query
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
We have caching behavior to reduce the latency from DB retrieval. Normal query responses are cached on the server side for short time (e.g. couple of minutes), to avoid duplicate query execution within short span of time, unless a **forced refresh** happens manually by the user where the cache will be discarded and query runs fully again.

However, on the frontend side, I do not see anyway to mark the `refetch` call as different (than the usual query of `useShow` etc.). 

In other words, the server does not know when to use cache and when to force refresh, based on the calls info.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Can Refine mark the `refetch` calls with some kind of header (`x-refetch`) etc.? 

if there is a way for the server to differentiate between a normal query (such as `useShow`) and the `refetch` it would be great.

issue_title: [FEAT] Retrieve error message accurately for axios
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When data provider uses `Axios` and queries (such as `useMany`, `useSelect` etc.) return errors, such as `500` the notification error displayed is not useful. It does not include the original message response received by the axios. 

Please refer the below notification screenshot for error 500 from server:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4610831/176987450-0890436c-903b-44d4-b280-af14d66457c6.png)

The below is the actual error response received (from the networks tab). Note that the there is important **message** that is completely ignored in the above notification error popup
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4610831/176987493-9700465c-cb5a-468f-83ef-96a409a78725.png)



**Describe the solution you'd like**
Currently there is no way to access the original error message received by the axios response. Please consider passing on the original error completely as-is for downstream consumption by the UI components, such as notificationProvider (currently notificationProvider cannot access this original message)

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Tried creating a custom notifiationProvider, but even that do not have access to the original error response.

**Additional context**

issue_title: [BUG] Strapi-V4 useMany has implicit pagination and pageSize
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**

Let´s suppose I query strapi with this useMany hook and the ids array have 100 ids:

```
const postQueryResult = useMany<IPost>({
    resource: "posts",
    ids: [1, 2,3,4,5,6 ... 96,97,98,99,100],
});

```
Strapi will only return the first 25 ids and refine wont call a warning or throw an error.
As for default, strapi imposes a 25 items limit on its API: https://docs.strapi.io/developer-docs/latest/setup-deployment-guides/configurations/optional/api.html

For default, on refinejs code, I cant set a pagination to increase the amount of ids strapi should response, but this pagination is available on other hooks.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Make a useMany query with more than 25 ids
2. Check response and you will se it will be limited to 25 ids.

**Expected behavior**
It would be ideal for refine.js throw a warning and a property/method to be available to change pagination, as there is on useTable hook.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows
 - Browser Chrome
 - Version 3.25.2
 - Used dataProvider Strapi

**Additional context**
I don´t know yet how to do a pull request on strapi, I tried to do some changes on efine-strapi-v4 code but I couldn´t build it. It says CJS error (or something like this). 

If you open https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/next/packages/strapi-v4/src/dataProvider.ts and look at getList function (line 137), it seems that you can just copy hasPagination and pagination  propeties and its code to the getMany function and it may solve the issue.

issue_title: [BUG] refineCoreProps is ignored when using initialState with useTable from @pankod/refine-react-table
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
When using `useTable` from `@pankod/refine-react-table` and passing both `initialState` and `refineCoreProps` the latter gets ignored.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Bootstrap a sample application following the [tutorial](https://refine.dev/docs/core/tutorial/) for headless refine up until the `Handling relationships` section. 
2. On the posts list page add this
```js
{
        id: 'category',
        Header: 'Category ID',
        accessor: 'category.id',
},
```
to the columns object and set `hiddenColumns` and `initialSorter` in the `useTable` hook like this:
```js
const { getTableProps, getTableBodyProps, headerGroups, prepareRow, rows } = useTable({
    columns,
    initialState: { hiddenColumns: ['createdAt'] },
    refineCoreProps: { initialSorter: [{ field: 'category.id', order: 'asc' }] },
});
```

**Expected behavior**
I would expect to not see the `createdAt` column anymore and to have the table sorted based on `category.id`, however the table is not sorted. If I remove `initialState: { hiddenColumns: ['createdAt'] }`, then `refineCoreProps` gets evaluated and the table is sorted accordingly.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: macOS 12.3.1
 - Browser: Mozilla Firefox
 - Version: 101.0.1
 - Used dataProvider: Simple Rest API

issue_title: [FEAT] Allow sorting on a related table field using supabase dataprovider
[BUG] Invalid hook calls using the documentation suggested approach for handling data relationships in material-ui datagrid
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
As of today the docs describe this as the proper way to fetch data from a related field.

```
            {
                field: "category.id",
                headerName: "Category",
                type: "number",
                minWidth: 250,
                flex: 1,
                valueGetter: (params) => {
                    const { data } = useOne<ICategory>({
                        resource: "categories",
                        id: params.row.category.id,
                    });
                    return data?.data.title;
                },
            },
```

This produces the following 3 issues:
1. React complains about the ilegal invocation: 
```
react-dom.development.js:14906 Uncaught Error: Invalid hook call. Hooks can only be called inside of the body of a function component. This could happen for one of the following reasons:
1. You might have mismatching versions of React and the renderer (such as React DOM)
2. You might be breaking the Rules of Hooks
3. You might have more than one copy of React in the same app
See https://reactjs.org/link/invalid-hook-call for tips about how to debug and fix this problem.
```
2. Keyboard controls of the data grid stop working after clicking / focusing the cell with the ilegal invocation.
3. ESLint rule `react-hooks/rules-of-hooks` nags you for using hooks inside of a function.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Try to handle relationships as advised in the docs

**Expected behavior**
Should work without eslint warnings or console errors



**Additional context**

Defering the `useOne` invocation to a real component solves the issue. I used a generic HOC to get rid of this issue.

Here is how I did it in my project. Pardon my inline typescripts hacks. Some of the types were not exported in the library.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55319644/176010409-ce0692ab-ad4f-4e53-8a27-3c55b3b13ec8.png)

On nextjs refine version greater than 3.20, some antd hooks do not work: useEditableTable and useModalForm

```
npx superplate-cli -p refine-nextjs tutorial

✔ Cloned remote source successfully.
✔ What will be the name of your app · tutorial
✔ Do you want to use an UI Framework?: · antd

✔ Data Provider: · custom-json-rest-data-provider

✔ Do you want to customize layout? · custom-layout
✔ i18n - Internationalization: · i18n-antd
✔ Would you like to share your choices with us anonymously? · no
```

3. Edit posts list screen

Use 'useEditableTable' instead of 'useTable'i in '/src/components/posts/list.tsx'

```
const { 
    isEditing,
    saveButtonProps,
    cancelButtonProps,
    editButtonProps,
    tableProps, sorter } = useEditableTable<IPost>({});
```

```
<Table.Column<IPost>
        title="Inline Actions"
        dataIndex="inlineActions"
        key="inlineActions"
        render={(_text, record) => {
            if (isEditing(record.id!!)) {
                return (
                    <Space>
                        <SaveButton {...saveButtonProps} size="small" />
                        <Button {...cancelButtonProps} size="small">
                            Cancel
                        </Button>
                    </Space>
                );
            }
            return (
                <Space>
                    <EditButton
                        {...editButtonProps(record.id!!)}
                        size="small"
                    />
                </Space>
            );
        }}
    />
```


5. Launch server and go to posts listing page: http://localhost:3000/posts
6. You are redirected on https://api.fake-rest.refine.dev/posts/undefined 

**Expected behavior**

Inline editing must be active.
If I use the web app version of refine `npx superplate-cli -p refine-react tutorial`, it works.

issue_title: [BUG] Sider mixes dark and light theme classes
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
Default sider mixes dark and light AntD themes in its children. I have been checking and it seems that the issue comes from AntD as it has different defaults for the Layout.Sider component, and the Menu component, the first default to dark and the later to light theme.

If you want to use your own css extended from the default AntD you have to mix light and dark configurations which shouldn't be needed.

**To Reproduce**
It's as easy as using the default AntD styles instead of the Refine provided one "antd/dist/antd.css". If you do that in the default generated application that you get following the tutorial you get a sider that mixes dark and light themes. See screenshot below.

**Expected behavior**
The theme setup should be consistent between the default provided elements so it's possible to easily override it using AntD styles. One solution may be to set a default dark or light and provide an option to override it on the Sider.

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot 2022-05-31 at 16 36 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4696279/171199944-987190bd-41db-4868-88fc-cd6e755dae7b.png)

issue_title: [BUG] getOne (to show and edit one item) does not work properly with id's that has special characters
issue_body:
when i list my elements, theirs id's are like : "UHJvdmlkZXJUeXBlOjE=" when it's being passed to the URL (in show and edit) the special characters like "=" are being encoded so we get a url like : "resource/show/UHJvdmlkZXJUeXBlOjE%3D" this make the detection of the resource name and id don't work, it would detect the resource to be the full URI like so : "resource/show/UHJvdmlkZXJUeXBlOjE%3D" and the id is an empty string : ""
i eventually made it work by specifying the operation manually in metaData of useShow and passing the recordItem in the Show component, but i thing it's against the automation principles that refine work with specially that i'm not creating a custom page.

issue_title: [BUG] syncWithLocation doesn't track URL changes
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
In the `useTable` hook `sycnWithLocation` was not watching the `URL` changes. As a result, the values followed by the URL, such as pagination, were not reset to initial values when the same resource was selected from the Sider.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Enable `syncWithLocation`
2. Go to any listing page
3. Make a filter/pagination/sorting
4. Click the same resource item from the `Sider` menu
5. See URL

**Expected behavior**

The page should return to the `initialState` when the same resource is called.

issue_title: [BUG] @pankod/refine-nhost is not handling graphQL error responses
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
The `@nhost/nhost-js` does not throw errors for graphQL errors, instead it returns `error` field in the return value. Callers are expected to check for the `error` field in the return values and act appropriately.

https://github.com/nhost/nhost/blob/19ccc5ab0d69ba516305548678e09807809845c3/packages/nhost-js/src/clients/graphql.ts#L55-L60
 
However,
The `refine-nhost` is not considering this situation and is not handling the error return values. 
https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/38278e6b61af8c4cbf90d61e790bd619825fead5/packages/nhost/src/index.ts#L203-L204

This is leading to situation where the error message is eaten away by the `refine-nhost` and no way for the app or caller to know about the graphQL error responses. App gets a "success" notification, but the backend does not have the data and no way to know about it (since console log also does not show any errors).

**To Reproduce**
Use `refine-nhost` to make a graphQL query that returns errors (such as permission error) etc.

**Expected behavior**
Error message should be thrown or notification should be displayed

issue_title: [FEAT] Add support for "id" prop in "useForm" hook
issue_body:
Refine already supports the `id` parameter in `useShow` hook, but not in the `useForm` hook. Currently, the only way to specify the resource's `id` in `useForm` is by calling the method `setId` that is returned by the hook. 

My use case is: I want to create an edit form, in a Custom Page. It would be easier if I could only specify the resource's `id` directly in the `useForm` hook, instead of calling the `setId` method somewhere in the component (I'm currently calling `setId` inside an `useEffect` hook).

This feature was discussed previously in a similar issue: https://github.com/pankod/refine/issues/1729#issuecomment-1102137974, and it seems to be possible to implement, as the `useShow` hook already supports the parameter `id`.

issue_title: findDOMNode is deprecated in StrictMode in Ant Design.
[DOC] Dependent Queries
issue_body: ## Is this issue related to an existing part of the documentation? If so, please provide a link 1. Added helpful info on using dependent queries from React Query. 2. Refine documentation page: https://refine.dev/docs/core/hooks/data/useMany/ 3. React query documentation page: https://react-query.tanstack.com/guides/dependent-queries ## Describe the thing to improve Dependent query is useful in a case where there are queries that depend on a preceding query's results. This can be added to the Refine documentation to make the documentation more robust. Personally, I ran into a problem where I had 5 queries, 4 of which depend on the first query's result. What happens is all 5 queries appear to run synchronously on load and 4 error messages popped up once before running successfully for the second time. The random error messages popping up can be distracting for the end user. This issue can be resolved with the use of dependent queries from React Query's useQuery options. ## Describe the solution (optional) I can create a pull request and add the following to the documentation: :::tip `useQuery` options also allows you to implement dependent query whereby a query is only executed after a particular query result is fetched. This is particularly useful if you have queries that are dependent on the query results of a preceding query. [Refer to react-query docs on **dependent queries** for more information.](https://react-query.tanstack.com/guides/dependent-queries) - Suppose you want this query to run after `id_query_result` is fetched by a preceding query, you can set `enabled` to `!!id_query_result`. ```tsx const categoryQueryResult = useMany({ resource: "categories", ids: ids_query_result, queryOptions: { enabled: !!id_query_result }, }); ``` :::

issue_title: [FEAT] Nested resources
issue_body:
I have an API endpoint that goes like: `/api/admin/stores/:store_id/employees/:id`
Where `:store_id` and `:id` can both be an integer.

I would like to be able to create nested resources like this (for example: Employees resources that belongs to a specific Store).

I don't know if this is possible with the current multi-level menu, I've checked the documentation but it doesn't include the `:store_id` part in the URL, nor in the hooks (useList, etc) API requests.

Does anyone know how to implement this feature with the current version of refine? Or is it impossible right now?

My suggestion would be to approach this with a React Context, storing the selected `:store_id` (from a Select input, for example), and passing as a parameter to the resource, but I'm guessing the only way to do this is by creating a Custom Page and implement the API request with axios or something.

I'm using these dependencies in my package.json (basically refine + react + typescript + antd), and I've deleted my yarn.lock and reinstalled just now, so I could get the most recent version (right now in my yarn.lock has `"@pankod/refine-core" "^3.14.0"`):

issue_title: [FEAT] Make links more accessible
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently, most links in Refine do not produce anchors, i.e. it is possible to navigate, but there is no link that could be displayed by browser and it's impossible to open a link in a new tab or window. Usability and accessibility are thus diminished.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
`useRouterContext` already provides a `Link` component, which can provide proper anchors without breaking SPA concept. It needs to be used throughout the framework.

I'm going to provide an PoC PR for further discussion.

issue_title: [BUG] `refine-react-router-v6` does not apply `options.route` correctly
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**

Given a configuration with two resources: 

```
                resources={[
                    {
                        name: 'users',
                        list: UserList
                    },
                    {
                        name: 'users',
                        list: LegacyUserList,
                        options: {
                            dataProviderName: 'users-legacy'
                            route: 'users-legacy',
                            label: 'Users (Legacy)'
                        },
                    }]
```

While both routes are available in the sense that they do not return 404 errors, the routing differs between versions.

With `refine-react-router`:

* `/users` renders `UserList`
* `/users-legacy` renders `LegacyUserList`

With `refine-react-router-v6`:

* `/users` renders `UserList`
* `/users-legacy` renders `UserList`

Also, `refine-react-router-v6` doesn't use the correct data provider, the rendering is exactly the same for `/users` and `/users-legacy`.

**Expected behavior**
`v6` should render the same as `v5`.

issue_title: [FEAT] Add support for `and` conditional filter
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Now that the conditional or filter is available (see https://github.com/pankod/refine/issues/1417) it would be cool to have a complementary `and` filter such that the following query becomes possible:

```sql
OR(
  AND(
    {title} == "The Great Divide",
    {age} < 10,
  ),
  AND(
    {title} == "The New Era",
    {age} < 20,
  )
)
```

This would allow to construct complex filters for different situations. Currently it's only possible to do the following:
```sql
AND(
  OR(
    {title} == "The Great Divide",
    {title} == "The New Era",
  ),
  OR(
    {age} < 10,
    {age} < 20,
  )
)
```

One can notice however that these are not the same and the condition for the age is now not tied to the specific titles and in this example `{age} < 10` actually being useless since `{age} < 20` already satisfies it.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
An additional `and` filter based on the same principle as the `or` filter.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
The top-level implicit `AND` that already exists is good but does limit the queries we can construct if we need to narrow down results individually.

issue_title: [FEAT] Allow the customizing of `DeleteButton`'s Popconfirm's props
issue_body:
I'd like to suggest adding some customization options for the Popconfirm wrapper of DeleteButton and maybe all of the other pre-wired buttons.

e.g
```ts
        <Table.Column<CompanyProps>
          dataIndex="actions"
          title="Actions"
          render={(_t, record) => (
              <DeleteButton 
                  recordItemId={record.id}
                  confirmTitle={`ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO DELETE ${record?.name}???? BE CAREFUL!!!!`}
              />)}
        />
```

Of course, one could achieve the functionality themselves by combining `useDelete`,  `Popconfirm` and `Button`, but it could be nice to spare the users this wiring :)

you guys are cool 😎

Django-Admin implements two buttons on its edit pages: "Save" and "Save and continue editing". The latter is sorely missed in Refine.

issue_title: [Bug] Using multiple hooks in the same component will init wrong request
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
I put 2 hooks (useForm and useEditableTable) on the same Edit component:
+ useForm (resource_A) will init request to /api/**resource_A**/:**id_of_resource_A** --> it's correct.
+ useEdittableTable (resource_B) will also init request to /api/**resource_B**/:**id_of_resource_A** --> it's maybe wrong if this ID of entity not exists on resource_B

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to file /src/pages/post/edit.tsx
2. Put both useForm({ resource: 'posts' }) and useEditableTable({ resource: 'categories' }) inside EditComponent
3. Please make sure that is not exists category with ID 123.
4. Switch to the browser and go to localhost/posts/edit/123
5. Open tab network on developer tool to see that EditComponent init 2 requests to /api/posts/123 and /api/categories/123. In while the category 123 not exists, so the notification will push error after 3 times.

**Expected behavior**
- Add one option to prevent the useEdittableTable hook will not retrieve detail.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26864805/156337188-c4dc9c9c-0549-4395-9006-e16ef3944426.png)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

 - Browser: Firefox
 - Version: 97.0
 - Used dataProvider: Strapi-v4

issue_title: [DOC] Improve Ant Design useTable sorting
issue_body:
**Describe the thing to improve**
In the sorting process, first of all, the column's "key" property is used as the column name, if not exist, the "dataIndex" property is used. we should state this clearly in the docs.

Code: https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/e6909125ea133b94340ce1411b5e8dab56f112e5/packages/antd/src/definitions/table/index.ts#L59

Doc: https://refine.dev/docs/ui-frameworks/antd/hooks/table/useTable/#sorting

Upon running the app with `yarn dev`, I'm greeted with an error screen `TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'push')`. Deleting the yarn lock file and reinstalling packages does not help. The new lock file is exactly the same as the deleted one.

Using pnpm to install packages works up to a point. I'm able to see the login screen. But clicking the login button throws `TypeError: history.replace is not a function` in the console.

5. Delete node_modules and yarn lock file.
6. Install packages with pnpm.
7. Run the app.
8. Visit the app url in your browser.
9. Attempt to login with `admin` username.
10. See second error in browser console.

I expected to see a welcome screen or a login page.

[FEAT] Support `react-query`'s `useQueries`
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Trying to implement a "number of comments for a post" column (on `simple-rest` data provider), I've found there is no built-in way to make multiple requests, which are more or less required for this to work (see also `ReferenceManyField` from `react-admin`). See https://discord.com/channels/837692625737613362/906206669787234334/939907409634283570 for a bit of discussion.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
There is a `useQueries` in `react-admin`, which seems to do what's required. It would be nice to have a wrapper of some sort -- maybe separate new hooks, maybe built-in support for arrays in `useList` etc. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Currently, I'm building a weird loop around `dataProvider.getList` (see Discord discussion), which feels very low-level and quirky.

issue_title: [BUG] Upgrade to react-scripts v5 killed all Craco / LESS functionality on Node 16
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
All the examples, tutorials and templates have been upgraded to `react-scripts` v5 in https://github.com/pankod/refine/commit/b73577793f5c4bd4d90e88a297c09df53e183d11. Default and proposed configuration and also documented behaviours should work out of the box.

issue_title: [FEAT] Dynamic resource options
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

I wanted to do things dynamically.. To do this I needed to get columns based on a table. This  information is stored in  meta tables. The table names may have the same name as they belong to different schemas. To do that I needed to make sure I was getting column information of the correct table. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The solution I would like is to allow an extra property such as a ID or Object as options to a resource. This options should be accessible to list, edit, show and create views. The most general solution would be to allow an options object where we can pass extra information besides label and route.  We are migrating from react admin and this was how they did it.
[passing options to resource.](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/Resource.html#options)

issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
On useEditForm.ts (https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/master/packages/core/src/hooks/form/useEditForm/useEditForm.ts#L115) the hook gets the id from the route and decodes it before calling getOne. However on the crud edit component (https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/master/packages/core/src/components/crud/edit/index.tsx#L106) the refresh button uses the encoded id to update the values.

I discovered this because we use base64 ids with graphQL so it is common to have `=` at the end.

**To Reproduce**

**Expected behavior**

issue_title: [BUG] Babel aliases do not work in non-Babel environments
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**

Refine defines several Babel aliases in its distribution in `.babelrc`: 
```
{
    "plugins": [
        [
            "module-resolver",
            {
                "root": "./",
                "alias": {
                    "@components": "./src/components",
                    "@containers": "./src/containers",
                    "@pages": "./src/pages",
                    "@contexts": "./src/contexts",
                    "@dataProviders": "./src/dataProviders",
                    "@hooks": "./src/hooks",
                    "@test": "./test",
                    "@definitions": "./src/definitions"
                }
            }
        ]
    ]
}
```

These aliases do not get resolved in any non-Babel environment, like [Vite](https://vitejs.dev/), leading to errors.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Initialize a new Vite project with React and TypeScript with `npm init vite@latest` (https://vitejs.dev/guide/#scaffolding-your-first-vite-project).
2. Follow first steps on Refine tutorial (https://refine.dev/docs/) until just before "Adding resources" chapter. 
3. Run `npm run build`
4. Observe errors in the console like `ERROR(TypeScript)  Cannot find module '@components' or its corresponding type declarations.`

**Expected behavior**

Should work with Vite just like it does with `create-react-app`.

issue_title: [BUG] useNavigation hook gives 404 error when id of resource contains slash(/)
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
When using different methods of the `useNavigation` hook like `show`, `edit`, etc. it returns a 404 page not found error if the id of the resource contains a slash(/). For example, if the id of the resource is `ABC/2` then it redirects to `/ABC/2` instead of `/ABC%2F2` thus causing a 404 error.

**To Reproduce**
Use the show, edit or any other method of the `useNavigation` hook using a resource which has a slash in its id. 

**Expected behavior**
Encode and Decode the params of the URL so that it  redirects to `/ABC%2F2`

issue_title: Update Dataprovider for Appwrite >0.12
issue_body:
The recent relase of Appwrite 0.12 has changed the database API of Appwrite. Specifically the permissions have been changed. The `"*"` wildcard permission has been replaced by `"role:all"`. You can find more info in the [Migration Guide](https://dev.to/appwrite/appwrite-012-migration-post-3cha) blog post.

I found 4 instances of falling back to the `"*"` wildcard in the provider:
https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/cba0000f86d35774f9b397fcf3a2f4edae62a739/packages/appwrite/src/index.ts#L139
https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/cba0000f86d35774f9b397fcf3a2f4edae62a739/packages/appwrite/src/index.ts#L140

https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/cba0000f86d35774f9b397fcf3a2f4edae62a739/packages/appwrite/src/index.ts#L155

https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/cba0000f86d35774f9b397fcf3a2f4edae62a739/packages/appwrite/src/index.ts#L172
https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/cba0000f86d35774f9b397fcf3a2f4edae62a739/packages/appwrite/src/index.ts#L173

https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/cba0000f86d35774f9b397fcf3a2f4edae62a739/packages/appwrite/src/index.ts#L226
https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/cba0000f86d35774f9b397fcf3a2f4edae62a739/packages/appwrite/src/index.ts#L227

issue_title: [BUG] Custom route name does not take effect with `refine-nextjs-router`
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
Custom route name does not take effect with `refine-nextjs-router`.

**To Reproduce**
1. Register resource with custom route
```javascript
{
  name: "foo",
  options: {
    route: "/custom/foo",
  }
}
```
2. Create dynamic nextjs pages
```
pages/custom/[resource]
pages/custom/[resource]/index.tsx
...
```
3. Request `/custom/foo`, the server return `404`

**Expected behavior**
The server should return resource page as expected.

**Additional context**
Look at the following codes
https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/69b36225c3d097dfe5f9d915cc81c47a49280a9b/packages/nextjs-router/src/nextRouteComponent.tsx#L36
Nextjs router find resource by comparing `resource name` and `resource.route`, but `resource.route` is changeable.

The following codes worked for me
```js
const resource = resources.find((res) => res.name === routeResourceName); 
```
Or
```js
const resource = resources.find((res) => res.name === routeResourceName || res.route === routeResourceName); 
```

issue_title: [FEAT] Add ability to combine filters into OR arrangement
[FEAT] Preserve filters and page number when navigating back from create/update page
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When clicking on back on an update page or after save, the user is taken to the first page without any sorting or filters applied.
As a user It would be nice for filters, sorting and the current page number to stay the same when navigating back to the list of records after updating a record or clicking on the back arrow.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Refine could keep track of the sorting, filters, and page number in the URL (would make it possible to bookmark or share these too) which could then be used for back navigation.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None so far. But I assume this might need some work to save all of this data onto the URL and then update filters, sorting and page numbers accordingly. Especially filters and sorting might need a breaking change - not sure if this change would not go against their current API.

**Additional context - Example**

![refine-stateful-url-suggsion](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6438760/148128597-3bf44ac3-83ec-4d87-a7b2-ba5efcc829f1.gif)

1. Go to list page
2. Go to second page
3. Click on edit
4. Click on back
5. Observe that we are on the first page again

issue_title: [BUG] Clearing filter through the clear button in filterDropdown resets operator to eq with no way to switch it back
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
The clear button in the filterDropdown resets not just the value but also the operator always to "eq". This makes it impossible to use any other operator after clearing the filter.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a record list with filters other than `eq` (for example `contains`)
2. Filter items by something
3. Observe that the set filter operator (eg. `contains`) worked properly
4. Now click the clear button in the dropdown and then filter to get back all results
5. Observe that this works as well
6. Now open the filter again and filter by the same thing as in step 2
7. Observe that the results are now different since the filter operator switched from `contains` to `eq`

**Expected behavior**
The operator defined in `initialFilter` should not be reset when clearing a filter query. This is somewhat related to https://github.com/pankod/refine/issues/1373. Without the support for that the developer is unable to switch the operator manually so it's impossible to work around this behaviour.

**Screenshots**
![refine-double-filter-contains-bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6438760/147409745-76efabac-c9c1-4550-afc2-71b6c9f87255.gif)

React Query Debugging Window showing the 2 requests with the changed operator:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6438760/147409794-a72db6d9-57d3-4f7c-bd75-9c6ba1b02507.png)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows
 - Browser Edge
 - Version: 2.4.11
 - Used dataProvider: Airtable

issue_title: [FEAT] Draft: Add support to switch filter operator dynamically from useTable
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently it is only possible to set the filter operator on the initial call to `useTable`. This suggestion would allow switching between full string filter (eq), negation (ne) or partial string match/not match (contains/ncontains).

Operators are set here initially:
https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/445baad768c51fc0c734ddf179402de2664ef471/packages/core/src/hooks/table/useTable/useTable.ts#L144-L146

The filter value can be changed but not the operator:
https://github.com/pankod/refine/blob/445baad768c51fc0c734ddf179402de2664ef471/packages/core/src/hooks/table/useTable/useTable.ts#L198-L211

**Describe the solution you'd like**
- Allow <FilterDropdown> changing the operator through props
  - Breaking change?
  - Would antd even allow this for filter?

    ```tsx
    <Table.Column 
        dataIndex="contentName"
        filterDropdown={({ dropdownProps, filterOperatorProps }) => { // Would something like this even work?
            return (
                <Fragment>
                    <Select onChange={filterOperatorProps.onChange}>
                        <Select.Option value="eq">Equals</Select.Option>
                        <Select.Option value="ne">Not Equal</Select.Option>
                    </Select>
                    <FilterDropdown {...dropdownProps}><Input /></FilterDropdown>
                </Fragment>
            )
        }}
    />
    ``` 

- Export a helper method from `useTable`, something like `changeFilterOperator(forField: string, newOperator: CrudOperators)` which could be hooked up manually
  - More work for the developer to hook it up but not breaking
  - Supports changing the filter outside the dropdown too which is cool
  - The operator change input field/select would most likely already be inside of the `dropdownFilter` render prop of a column so specifying the column name/field again seems redundant
 
    ```tsx
     const { changeFilterOperator, ...tableProps } = useTable({});

     ...

     useEffect(() => {
         changeFilterOperator("contentName", "contains"); // We can change the filter operator outside of the dropdown
         // Maybe even the value itself with a slightly different signature
         // changeFilter("contentName", "contains", someWeirdValue);
     }, [someWeirdValue])

    <Table.Column 
        dataIndex="contentName" // First column specification
        filterDropdown={(props) => {
            return (
                <Fragment>
                    <Select onChange={(newOp) => changeFilterOperator("contentName", newOp)}> // "contentName" must be specified here again
                        <Select.Option value="eq">Equals</Select.Option>
                        <Select.Option value="ne">Equals</Select.Option>
                    </Select>
                    <FilterDropdown {...props}><Input /></FilterDropdown>
                </Fragment>
            )
        }}
    />
    ``` 

> Work in Progress

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
- Making the initially passed options to `useTable` dynamic so changing them changes the filters state
  - Unintuitive since it behaves differently than react hooks
  - Would overwrite user input or developer would have to merge in current filter input themselves
  - The name of the option is `initialFilters` not `filters` - it's not intuitive that changing these should result in updates

issue_title: [DOC] Specify project node version in Contributions
issue_body:
**Is this issue related to an existing part of the documentation? If so, please provide a link**
I think Contributions would be a good place to put this into.

**Describe the thing to improve**
I was not sure which version of node to use for development but I see that package-lock.json is at version 1 so I opted for the latest node 14 version which finally did not seem to adjust package-lock.json on initial install.

My initial install with node 17 upgraded the whole package-lock.json which should not usually not be something a contributor does (I know I hate it when contributors create a PR with 50k lines of changes since they changed the lock version or structure by using a newer node/npm/yarn version). 😅 

**Describe the solution (optional)**
Either a version file (.nvm, .tool-versions or similar) with the node version or a mention on the [contributing](https://refine.dev/docs/contributing/) page would be good to have.

issue_title: [BUG] Caching does not work with useTable due to the returned loading attribute set to true during re-validation
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
With the changes introduced in https://github.com/pankod/refine/pull/1319 `useTable` properly returns loading as true while loading is being performed on new requests but now also incorrectly returns true while react query revalidates the response.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to list page
2. Click on a new page through pagination
3. Observe that loader correctly displays
4. Click on previous page
5. Observe that loader appears again even though data is already there (react query merely revalidates the cache at this point)

**Expected behavior**
Loading should not appear when a cached response is ready to be served. This can be achieved by relying either on `status` or on `isSuccess` instead of `isFetching` (which is also true while revalidating cache).

See for solution suggestion https://github.com/pankod/refine/pull/1319#issuecomment-993494500

**Screenshots**
Also shown in suggestion mentioned above.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Browser: Edge
 - Version: 2.4.5
 - Used dataProvider: Custom Mock Implementation

**Additional context**
I wasn't sure if I should create a new issue for this but thought it's better to keep track of it separately since it deals with something slightly different from https://github.com/pankod/refine/issues/1316.

issue_title: [FEAT] Limit Offset Pagination for simple-rest-provider?
issue_body: Currently the simple-rest data provider has the feature of paginating queries based on starting and ending values. It would be great if other pagination formats such as limit offset pagination, page number pagination, etc. could be incorporated so as to enable to seamlessly connect to other third party backend REST applications such as the DJango rest framework.

issue_title: [FEAT] filter support for Airtable
issue_body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I see that the list query for data providers allows for passing a filter in. It seems the Airtable data provider does not support this yet.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Airtable does support filtering through the [`filterByFormular`](https://vancelucas.com/blog/airtable-api-filterbyformula/) query parameter (supported by the Airtable JS library too). A library like https://github.com/Qualifyze/airtable-formulator can be used to ensure type safety and an ORM-like interface between them.

**Additional context**
I can create a PR with the changes to the Airtable provider to enable this. It just needs a translation layer to transform the Refine CrudFilters into a string that can be given to `filterByFormula` similar to eg.  the strapi data provider package and co

Type '{ Authorization: string; }' is not assignable to type 'HeadersDefaults'.

It should be

            axiosInstance.defaults.headers.common = {

issue_title: [BUG] Wrong filter operators in refine-supabase
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
There is a wrong switch case in the refine-supabase dataProvider `generateFilter` function, `contains` and `containss` are reversed. At the moment `contains`, which should be case-insensitive, is using the `like` operator, which is case-sensitive. Meanwhile `containss`, which should be case-sensitive, is using the `ilike` operator, which is case-insensitive.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Bootstrap a new refine project using supabase as dataProvider
2. Add a select filter on a resource field
3. Try to filter the select options using a lowercase value where there should be an uppercase one
4. The select will not find that option

**Expected behavior**
The select filter should be able to find the option


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: MacOS 12.0.1
 - Browser Chrome 
 - Version 96.0.4664.55
 - Used dataProvider refine-supabase

issue_title: [BUG] Race condition (probably) between useForm and useShow()
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
When using `{ queryResult } = useShow()` and passing queryResult to `use(Modal)Form` with defaultFormValues, often yields empty defaultFormValues. 

**To Reproduce**
have a sort of this code in a Show context component:
```ts
  const { queryResult } = useShow();
  const { data, isLoading } = queryResult;
  record = data?.data
  const { formProps } = useForm({
    action: 'create',
    resource: 'cars',
    defaultFormValues: { person_id: record?.id },
  })
  console.log("Record: ", record?.id)
  console.log("Initial person id: ", formProps.initialValues.person_id)
```
follow the logs and see that even after `Record` gets populated with a value, `initial person id` is still undefined.

**Expected behavior**
I'd expect both logged values to match.


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: MacOs 12
 - Browser Chrome
 - Version 96+
 - Used dataProvider simle-rest

**Additional context**
I think that all of the hooks should be always re-evaluated, except for their "side-effect" parts, which should get a dependency array, just like useEffect. in this case there's no need to make any requests or side effects (I think...) so there's no reason not to run the hook again.

issue_title: [BUG] TypeError: Cannot redefine property: __esModule when running jest
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
When running jest refine is throwing the following error:
```
    TypeError: Cannot redefine property: __esModule
        at Function.defineProperty (<anonymous>)

      at node_modules/@pankod/refine/dist/refine.cjs.development.js:7172:31
          at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
      at Object.<anonymous> (node_modules/@pankod/refine/dist/refine.cjs.development.js:7171:25)
      at Object.<anonymous> (node_modules/@pankod/refine/dist/index.js:7:20)
```

Looking at the stack trace it brings us to the following code in `dist/refine.cjs.development.js` but if we make the following change the error goes away.
```diff
Object.keys(reactQuery).forEach(function (k) {
-  if (k !== 'default') Object.defineProperty(exports, k, {
+  if (k !== 'default' && k !== '__esModule') Object.defineProperty(exports, k, {
    enumerable: true,
    get: function () {
      return reactQuery[k];
    }
  });
});
```
It may be a problem with the way refine re-exports react query.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Initialize the default boilerplate
2. Install modules:
   - Jest: `27.2.5`
   - TypeScript: `4.2.4`
   - Refine: `1.0.76`
   - React testing library: `11.2.6`
3. Run the jest tests on the source App component

**Expected behavior**
The unit tests should run without that error being thrown

**Screenshots**
![Screen Shot 2021-10-08 at 2 05 09 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25378294/136612459-557397d6-ee3b-4fc0-8b00-e82913d0733d.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: MacOS
 - Browser N/A
 - Version: Refine - `1.0.76`
 - Used dataProvider N/A

issue_title: finefoods e2e tests
issue_body:
finefoods'un e2e testlerini cypress ile yazalım.

- [ ] Login Page success login (authProvider & custom login page)
- [ ] dil değişimi (i18n)
- [ ] dashboard (Delivery Map kelimesi var mı?) (refine dashboard prop)
- [ ] filter syncWithLocation açık olduğu için url'e yazıyor mu? örneğins status'e göre filtre yaptık. url'de status filtresi yazıldı mı? (order page, useTable onSearch testi)
- [ ] order sayfasında sorting yaptık, hem url hem data değişti mi? (useTable sorting test)  - e2e example'da örneği var.
- [ ] order sayfasında pagination yaptık (useTable pagination test) - e2e example'da örneği var.

[BUG] useShow and useEditForm's id return values
issue_body:
Both `useShow` and `useEditForm` should return the id value they operate on. Currently they *do* return an id value (`editId` for `useEditForm` and `showId` for `useShow`) but they only return it if we set the id value explicitly. If no options provided, initial id return value is parsed from route and incorrectly returned as `undefined`.

Ideally, both hooks should return `id` value of the records they're working on at that moment, correctly.

issue_title: [BUG] undoable bildirimleri kaybolmuyor
issue_body:
**Describe the bug**
undoable bildirimleri hiç bir şey yapılmadan beklendiği zaman kaybolmuyor

**To Reproduce**
1. `mutationMode` değeri `undoable` olan bir mutation tetikleyin (many ya da tek)
2. 5 saniye bekleyin
4. kaybolmayan undoable bildirimi sağ üstte

**Expected behavior**
undoable bildirimi 5 saniye sonra kaybolmalı 

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22444985/128037816-53edcf62-1b34-42c5-964f-42449c5cfa22.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: macOS Big Sur
 - Browser: Chrome
 - Version: 92.0.4515.107 (Official Build) (x86_64)
 - Used dataProvider: "@pankod/refine-simple-rest"

**Additional context**
bu hata fineFoods projesinde yaşandı

issue_title: aside gereksiz render yapıyor
Examples İçin Dikkat Edilmesi Gerekenler
issue_body:
- `tsconfig.json` içerisinde `baseUrl` duplicate edilmiş mi?
- `package.json` içerisinde `name` property'si doğru mu?
- `public/manifest.json` içinde `name`'ler doğru mu?
- `public/index.html` içinde `title` doğru mu?
- CRUD componentleri (`<List>`, `<Show>`, `<Create>`, `<Edit>`) `{...props}` almasın.
- Aşağıdaki gibi `_value` değeri kullanılmıyorsa  sadece `_` şekilde yapalım.
```tsx
render={(_value, record) => (
    <Space>
        <EditButton size="small" recordItemId={record.id} />
        <ShowButton size="small" recordItemId={record.id} />
    </Space>
)}
```

- `<Table>` key attirbute'nü `rowKey` olarak değiştirelim. (console da bulunan hatayı engellemek için).
- `<Table.Column>`'ların aldığı `key` attirbute'ü console da hata vermiyorsa veya table'ın kullanımını bozmuyorsa kaldıralım. (Sorting veya Filter işlemi yapan table'larda ayrıca oralara dikkat edelim)
- Example içerisinde bulunan sayfalarda console hataları var mı? Var ise onları çözelim, çözemediğimiz durumlarda birbirimizle paylaşalım.
- Show sayfalarında aşağıdaki gibi bir kullanım yapalım. (Fragment kaldıralım, `record && ` kontrolünü kaldıralım)
```tsx
return (
    <Show isLoading={isLoading}>
        <Title level={5}>Id</Title>
        <Text>{record?.id}</Text>

        <Title level={5}>{translate("posts.fields.title")}</Title>
        <Text>{record?.title}</Text>

        <Title level={5}>{translate("posts.fields.category")}</Title>
        <Text>
            {categoryIsLoading ? "Loading..." : categoryData?.data.title}
        </Text>

        <Title level={5}>{translate("posts.fields.content")}</Title>
        <MarkdownField value={record?.content} />
    </Show>
);
```
- Interface'ler doğru mu? Interface içerisinde kullanılmayan field varsa kaldıralım.
- `React.useState`kullanımlarını `useState`'i import edip, sadece `useState` şeklinde yapalım.
